rapidCity.name: rapidCity
rapidCity.contactinfo: Edwin Tsang Postal: Bay Networks, Inc. 4401 Great America Parkway Santa Clara, CA 95052-8185 Tel: 408-495-6159 Fax: 408-495-5215 E-mail: edwin_tsang@baynetworks.com
rapidCity.description: Enterprise MIB for the Accelar product family.

rcSysCommReadWriteAll.name: rcSysCommReadWriteAll
rcSysCommReadWriteAll.description: When an SNMP message is received by this entity, the community string in the message is compared with this string first. If it matches, read-write access is granted to all items in the MIB. If it doesn't match, the rcSysCommReadWrite string is compared next.

rcSysCommReadWrite.name: rcSysCommReadWrite
rcSysCommReadWrite.description: When an SNMP message is received by this entity, the community string in the message is compared with this string second. If it matches, read-write access is granted to all items in the MIB except community strings. (Community strings appear empty when read and return a no such name error when an attempt is made to write them.) If it doesn't match, the rcSysCommReadWriteLayer3 string is compared next.

rcSysCommReadOnly.name: rcSysCommReadOnly
rcSysCommReadOnly.description: When an SNMP message is received by this entity, the community string in the message is compared with this string third. If it matches, read-only access is granted to all items in the MIB except community strings. (Community strings appear empty when read.) If it doesn't match, no access is granted, no response is sent back to the SNMP requester, and SNMP traps are sent to the SNMP trap receiver(s) if configured.

rcSysResult.name: rcSysResult
rcSysResult.description: Result from the last system action.

rcSysLastChange.name: rcSysLastChange
rcSysLastChange.description: Last management initiated configuration change since sysUpTime.

rcSysLastVlanChange.name: rcSysLastVlanChange
rcSysLastVlanChange.description: Last management initiated VLAN configuration change since sysUpTime.

rcSysLastStatisticsReset.name: rcSysLastStatisticsReset
rcSysLastStatisticsReset.description: Last management initiated statistics reset since sysUpTime.

rcSysBufferUtil.name: rcSysBufferUtil
rcSysBufferUtil.description: Buffer utilization as a percentage of the total amount of buffer space in the system. A high value indicates congestion.

rcSysBufferUtilPeak.name: rcSysBufferUtilPeak
rcSysBufferUtilPeak.description: The largest buffer utilization since sysUpTime

rcSysNVRamUsed.name: rcSysNVRamUsed
rcSysNVRamUsed.description: Non-volatile RAM in use in Kbytes

rcSysLastSaveToNVRam.name: rcSysLastSaveToNVRam
rcSysLastSaveToNVRam.description: SysUpTime of the last time when NVRAM was written to. This could be a save of the system configuration or via a file transfer of a configuration file.

rcSysLastSaveToStandbyNVRam.name: rcSysLastSaveToStandbyNVRam
rcSysLastSaveToStandbyNVRam.description: SysUpTime of the last time when the standby NVRAM (on the back-up CPU board) was written to.

rcSysRmonMemSize.name: rcSysRmonMemSize
rcSysRmonMemSize.description: Amount of RAM in bytes to allocate for RMON to use when rcSysRmonEnable is TRUE.

rcSysRmonEnable.name: rcSysRmonEnable
rcSysRmonEnable.description: Control whether the RMON feature should be enabled. To enable the RMON feature, set this variable to true. The RMON agent in the device will get started immediately if the amount of memory specified by rcSysRmonMemSize is currently available in the device. To disable the RMON feature, set this variable to false, save the new setting to NVRAM, and reboot the device. After the device is rebooted the RMON agent will not be operational.

rcSysRmonSaveConfig.name: rcSysRmonSaveConfig
rcSysRmonSaveConfig.description: Control whether RMON configuration information should be saved to NVRAM so RMON settings can be automatically reinstalled after a system reboot. Setting rcSysRmonSaveConfig to true does not immediately save the configuration information. The save happens when the rcSysAction variable is set to 'saveToNVRAM(4)'. This option is only meaningful when the rcSysRmonEnable variable is set to true.

rcSysRmonTrapOption.name: rcSysRmonTrapOption
rcSysRmonTrapOption.description: Used to indicate whether RMON traps should be sent to only the owner of the RMON alarm (i.e., the manager that created the alarm entry) or all trap recipients in the system trap receiver table.

rcSysSupportRouting.name: rcSysSupportRouting
rcSysSupportRouting.description: Used to indicate whether routing is supported in this product.

rcSysSupportWebServer.name: rcSysSupportWebServer
rcSysSupportWebServer.description: Used to indicate whether WebServer is supported in this product.

rcSysLastIpAddrChange.name: rcSysLastIpAddrChange
rcSysLastIpAddrChange.description: Last management initiated IP address change since sysUpTime. Any addition or deletion of an IP address to a single routable port or a VLAN is time-stamped by this variable.

rcSysCommReadWriteLayer3.name: rcSysCommReadWriteLayer3
rcSysCommReadWriteLayer3.description: When an SNMP message is received by this entity, the community string in the message is compared with this string third. If it matches, read-write access is granted to all Layer-3 items in the MIB except community strings. (Community strings appear empty when read and return a no such name error when an attempt is made to write them.) If it doesn't match, the rcSysCommReadWriteLayer2 string is compared next.

rcSysCommReadWriteLayer2.name: rcSysCommReadWriteLayer2
rcSysCommReadWriteLayer2.description: When an SNMP message is received by this entity, the community string in the message is compared with this string fourth. If it matches, read-write access is granted to all Layer-2 items in the MIB except community strings. (Community strings appear empty when read and return a no such name error when an attempt is made to write them.) If it doesn't match, the rcSysCommReadOnly string is compared next.

rcSysAccessPolicyEnable.name: rcSysAccessPolicyEnable
rcSysAccessPolicyEnable.description: Used to configure the system access policy feature. if 'true', the rcSysAccessPolicyTable is examined to determine which packets should be allowed or denied access to this device.

rcSysTrapRecvTable.name: rcSysTrapRecvTable
rcSysTrapRecvTable.description: The trap receiver table (0 to 25 entries). This table lists the addresses of Network Management Stations that should receive trap messages from this entity when an exception condition occurs.

rcSysTrapRecvCommunity.name: rcSysTrapRecvCommunity
rcSysTrapRecvCommunity.description: Community string used for trap messages to this trap receiver.

rcSysTrapRecvSrcAddress.name: rcSysTrapRecvSrcAddress
rcSysTrapRecvSrcAddress.description: Source IP address to use when sending traps. This IP address will be inserted into the source IP address field in the UDP trap packet.

rcSysAccessPolicyTable.name: rcSysAccessPolicyTable
rcSysAccessPolicyTable.description: Management access policy table. This table is used to permit or deny access to this device via the specified source Id.

rcSysAccessPolicyPolicyEnable.name: rcSysAccessPolicyPolicyEnable
rcSysAccessPolicyPolicyEnable.description: Indicate whether this policy is currently active.

rcSysAccessPolicyMode.name: rcSysAccessPolicyMode
rcSysAccessPolicyMode.description: Used to indicate whether a packet having a source IP address that matches this entry should be permitted to enter the device or denied access.

rcSysAccessPolicyService.name: rcSysAccessPolicyService
rcSysAccessPolicyService.description: Is represented as bitset to indicate which protocol this entry should be applied to.

rcSysAccessPolicyPrecedence.name: rcSysAccessPolicyPrecedence
rcSysAccessPolicyPrecedence.description: Used to indicate the precedence of this policy. The Lower the number the higher the precedence.

rcSysAccessPolicyTrustedHostAddr.name: rcSysAccessPolicyTrustedHostAddr
rcSysAccessPolicyTrustedHostAddr.description: Trusted IP address of host performing a rlogin into the device.

rcSysAccessPolicyTrustedHostUserName.name: rcSysAccessPolicyTrustedHostUserName
rcSysAccessPolicyTrustedHostUserName.description: User name on the trusted host performing a rlogin into the device.

rcSysAccessPolicyLog.name: rcSysAccessPolicyLog
rcSysAccessPolicyLog.description: Used to indicate whether logging should be performed if this policy was applied.

rcTftpHost.name: rcTftpHost
rcTftpHost.description: Name of source/destination host for the TFTP transfer.

rcTftpFile.name: rcTftpFile
rcTftpFile.description: Name of file for the TFTP transfer.

rcTftpResult.name: rcTftpResult
rcTftpResult.description: Contains result of the last Tftp action request.

rcVlanNumVlans.name: rcVlanNumVlans
rcVlanNumVlans.description: The number of VLANs currently defined in the switch.

rcVlanTable.name: rcVlanTable
rcVlanTable.description: A list of Virtual LAN entries. The number of entries is given by rcVlanNumVlans.

rcVlanEntry.name: rcVlanEntry
rcVlanEntry.description: Entry containing configuration information for a particular Virtual LAN. The relationship between the various port sets in a VLAN Entry are : o The set of ports defined by PortMembers must be a subset of the set of ports in the underlying STG of the VLAN. o The bitwise AND of PortMembers and NotAllowToJoin must be the empty set. o The bitwise OR of PortMembers and NotAllowToJoin must be the set of ports in the underlying STG of the VLAN. o The set of ports defined by StaticMembers must be a subset of the set of ports defined by PortMembers. o The bitwise XOR of PortMembers and StaticMembers defines the set of dynamic (potential) members of the VLAN. o The set of ports defined by ActiveMembers must be a subset of the set of ports defined by PortMembers.

rcVlanId.name: rcVlanId
rcVlanId.description: A value that uniquely identifies the Virtual LAN associated with this entry. This value corresponds to the lower 12 bits in the IEEE 802.1Q VLAN Tag.

rcVlanName.name: rcVlanName
rcVlanName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this VLAN.

rcVlanColor.name: rcVlanColor
rcVlanColor.description: An administratively-assigned color code for this VLAN. The value of this object is used by the VLAN Manager GUI tool to select a color when it draws this VLAN on the screen.

rcVlanHighPriority.name: rcVlanHighPriority
rcVlanHighPriority.description: A flag to note whether frames in this VLAN should be assigned a high switching priority.

rcVlanRoutingEnable.name: rcVlanRoutingEnable
rcVlanRoutingEnable.description: A flag to note whether IP routing is enabled in this VLAN.

rcVlanIfIndex.name: rcVlanIfIndex
rcVlanIfIndex.description: When rcVlanRoutingEnable is set to true(1), this value indicates the 'logical' ifIndex assigned to this VLAN. Otherwise, this value is meaningless and should be set to zero.

rcVlanResult.name: rcVlanResult
rcVlanResult.description: The result from the last VLAN action.

rcVlanStgId.name: rcVlanStgId
rcVlanStgId.description: Indicates the Spanning Tree Group (STG) used by this VLAN to determine the state of its ports. If this VLAN is not associated with any STG, this value should be set to zero.

rcVlanType.name: rcVlanType
rcVlanType.description: The type of VLAN, distinguished according to the policy used to define its port membership.

rcVlanPortMembers.name: rcVlanPortMembers
rcVlanPortMembers.description: The set of ports that are members (static or dynamic) of this VLAN.

rcVlanActiveMembers.name: rcVlanActiveMembers
rcVlanActiveMembers.description: The set of ports that are currently active in this VLAN. Active ports include all static ports and any dynamic ports where the VLAN policy was met.

rcVlanStaticMembers.name: rcVlanStaticMembers
rcVlanStaticMembers.description: The set of ports that are static members of this VLAN. A static member of a VLAN is always active and is never aged out.

rcVlanNotAllowToJoin.name: rcVlanNotAllowToJoin
rcVlanNotAllowToJoin.description: The set of ports that are not allowed to become members of this VLAN.

rcVlanProtocolId.name: rcVlanProtocolId
rcVlanProtocolId.description: The protocol identifier of this VLAN. This value is meaningful only if rcVlanType is equal to byProtocolId(3). For other VLAN types it should have the value none(0).

rcVlanSubnetAddr.name: rcVlanSubnetAddr
rcVlanSubnetAddr.description: The IP subnet address of this VLAN. This value is meaningful only if rcVlanType is equal to byIpSubnet(2). For other VLAN types it should have the value 0.0.0.0.

rcVlanSubnetMask.name: rcVlanSubnetMask
rcVlanSubnetMask.description: The IP subnet mask of this VLAN. This value is meaningful only if rcVlanType is equal to byIpSubnet(2). For other VLAN types it should have the value 0.0.0.0.

rcVlanAgingTime.name: rcVlanAgingTime
rcVlanAgingTime.description: The timeout period (in seconds) used for aging out dynamic members of this VLAN. This field is only relevant for policy-based VLANs.

rcVlanMacAddress.name: rcVlanMacAddress
rcVlanMacAddress.description: The MAC address assigned to the virtual router interface of this VLAN. This field is meaningful only if rcVlanRoutingEnable is equal to true(1).

rcVlanRowStatus.name: rcVlanRowStatus
rcVlanRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcVlanTable.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopEnable.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopEnable
rcVlanIgmpSnoopEnable.description: A flag to note whether IGMP Snooping is enabled on this VLAN.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopReportProxyEnable.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopReportProxyEnable
rcVlanIgmpSnoopReportProxyEnable.description: A flag to note whether IGMP Report Proxy is enabled on this VLAN.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopRobustness.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopRobustness
rcVlanIgmpSnoopRobustness.description: This variable allows tuning for the expected packet loss on a subnet. If a subnet is expected to be lossy, the Robustness variable may be increased. IGMP is robust to (Robustness - 1) packet losses.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopQueryInterval.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopQueryInterval
rcVlanIgmpSnoopQueryInterval.description: The interval (in seconds) between IGMP Host-Query packets transmitted on this interface.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopMRouterPorts.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopMRouterPorts
rcVlanIgmpSnoopMRouterPorts.description: The set of ports in this VLAN that provide connectivity to an IP Multicast router.

rcVlanUserDefinedPid.name: rcVlanUserDefinedPid
rcVlanUserDefinedPid.description: When rcVlanProtocolId is set to usrDefined(15) in a protocol-based VLAN, this field represents the 16-bit user defined protocol identifier.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopActiveQuerier.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopActiveQuerier
rcVlanIgmpSnoopActiveQuerier.description: IP address of multicast querier router.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopMRouterExpiration.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopMRouterExpiration
rcVlanIgmpSnoopMRouterExpiration.description: Multicast querier router aging time out.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopQuerierPort.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopQuerierPort
rcVlanIgmpSnoopQuerierPort.description: The port on which the multicast querier router was heard.

rcVlanPortTable.name: rcVlanPortTable
rcVlanPortTable.description: A table used to maintain VLAN port related information.

rcVlanPortEntry.name: rcVlanPortEntry
rcVlanPortEntry.description: Entry containing VLAN information regarding a particular port.

rcVlanPortIndex.name: rcVlanPortIndex
rcVlanPortIndex.description: An unique index used to identify a particular port in the system. This index is equal to the ifIndex of the port.

rcVlanPortNumVlanIds.name: rcVlanPortNumVlanIds
rcVlanPortNumVlanIds.description: Used to indicate the number of VLAN IDs that are stored in the rcVlanPortVlanIds variable.

rcVlanPortVlanIds.name: rcVlanPortVlanIds
rcVlanPortVlanIds.description: An array used to identify which VLANs this port is assigned to. Each VLAN ID is stored as a two octet value. The first octet in the pair holds bits 15-8 of the VLAN ID, while the second octet holds bits 7-0 of the VLAN ID.

rcVlanPortType.name: rcVlanPortType
rcVlanPortType.description: The type of port: access(1) or trunk(2).

rcVlanPortDiscardTaggedFrames.name: rcVlanPortDiscardTaggedFrames
rcVlanPortDiscardTaggedFrames.description: A flag used to determine how to process tagged frames received on this access port. When the flag is set, these frames are discarded by the forwarding process. When the flag is reset, these frames are processed normally. This field is meaningless when the port is not an access port and should be set to false(2).

rcVlanPortDiscardUntaggedFrames.name: rcVlanPortDiscardUntaggedFrames
rcVlanPortDiscardUntaggedFrames.description: A flag used to determine how to process untagged frames received on this trunk port. When the flag is set, these frames are discarded by the forwarding process. When the flag is reset, these frames are assigned to the VLAN specified by rcVlanPortDefaultVlanId. This field is meaningless when the port is not a trunk port and should be set to false(2).

rcVlanPortDefaultVlanId.name: rcVlanPortDefaultVlanId
rcVlanPortDefaultVlanId.description: The VLAN ID assigned to untagged frames received on this trunk port. This field is meaningless when the port is not a trunk port.

rcVlanMacTable.name: rcVlanMacTable
rcVlanMacTable.description: A table used to maintain MAC addresses assigned to a particular VLAN by MAC address.

rcVlanMacEntry.name: rcVlanMacEntry
rcVlanMacEntry.description: Entry containing VLAN information regarding a particular port.

rcVlanMacVlanId.name: rcVlanMacVlanId
rcVlanMacVlanId.description: An unique index used to identify a VLAN (by MAC address) in the system.

rcVlanMacAddr.name: rcVlanMacAddr
rcVlanMacAddr.description: An unique index used to identify a MAC address assigned to a particular VLAN.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopNumGroups.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopNumGroups
rcVlanIgmpSnoopNumGroups.description: The number of entries (rows) in the rcVlanIgmpSnoopTable.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopTable.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopTable
rcVlanIgmpSnoopTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for which there are members on a particular interface on a particular VLAN.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopVlanId.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopVlanId
rcVlanIgmpSnoopVlanId.description: The VLAN for which this entry contains information.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopIpAddress.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopIpAddress
rcVlanIgmpSnoopIpAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopIfIndex.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopIfIndex
rcVlanIgmpSnoopIfIndex.description: The interface for which this entry contains information for this IP multicast group address.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopMember.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopMember
rcVlanIgmpSnoopMember.description: The IP Address of the source of the membership report received for this IP Multicast group address on this interface. If no membership report has been received, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopExpiration.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopExpiration
rcVlanIgmpSnoopExpiration.description: The minimum amount of time remaining before this entry will be aged out.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopType.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopType
rcVlanIgmpSnoopType.description: The type of entry: dynamic(1) entries are created by snooping IGMP messages, static(2) entries are created via management.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticTable.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticTable
rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the statically- defined IP multicast groups for which there are members on a particular interface on a particular VLAN.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticVlanId.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticVlanId
rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticVlanId.description: The VLAN for which this entry contains information.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticIpAddress.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticIpAddress
rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticIpAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information. The address must fall within 224.0.1.0 to 239.255.255.255.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticMemberPorts.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticMemberPorts
rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticMemberPorts.description: The set of ports in this VLAN multicast traffic for the rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticIpAddress is to be forwarded to.

rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticRowStatus.name: rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticRowStatus
rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcVlanIgmpSnoopStaticTable.

rcChasSerialNumber.name: rcChasSerialNumber
rcChasSerialNumber.description: Unique serial number for this chassis.

rcChasNumSlots.name: rcChasNumSlots
rcChasNumSlots.description: The number of slots in the chassis available for plug-in cards.

rcChasNumPorts.name: rcChasNumPorts
rcChasNumPorts.description: The total number of ports currently installed in the chassis.

rcChasFanTable.name: rcChasFanTable
rcChasFanTable.description: This table contains information about power supplies.

rcChasFanEntry.name: rcChasFanEntry
rcChasFanEntry.description: Contains information regarding a power supply unit.

rcChasFanOperStatus.name: rcChasFanOperStatus
rcChasFanOperStatus.description: Actual status of the Fan: - unknown(1) - status can not be determined. - up(2) - present and supplying power. - down(3) - present, but failure indicated.

rcChasPowerSupplyTable.name: rcChasPowerSupplyTable
rcChasPowerSupplyTable.description: This table contains information about power supplies.

rcChasPowerSupplyEntry.name: rcChasPowerSupplyEntry
rcChasPowerSupplyEntry.description: Contains information regarding a power supply unit.

rcChasPowerSupplyOperStatus.name: rcChasPowerSupplyOperStatus
rcChasPowerSupplyOperStatus.description: Actual status of the power supply: - unknown(1) - status can not be determined. - empty(2) - power supply not installed. - up(3) - present and supplying power. - down(4) - present, but failure indicated.

rcChasPowerSupplyDetailTable.name: rcChasPowerSupplyDetailTable
rcChasPowerSupplyDetailTable.description: This table contains detailed information about power supplies.

rcChasPowerSupplyDetailEntry.name: rcChasPowerSupplyDetailEntry
rcChasPowerSupplyDetailEntry.description: Contains detailae info regarding a power supply unit.

rcCardTable.name: rcCardTable
rcCardTable.description: A table that contains information about the cards in this chassis. For those slots that do not contain a physical card, the table may be implemented to contain a conceptual row with the type of physical module set to 'chasCardEmpty', or it may be implemented to have no conceptual row instance.

rcCardIndex.name: rcCardIndex
rcCardIndex.description: A unique value for each module within the chassis. This value is determined by the chassis slot number where the module is inserted. Valid entries are 1 to the value of rcChasNumSlots

rcCardType.name: rcCardType
rcCardType.description: Used to indicate a card type. Gigabit cards use an encoded value according to the following rule: +-----+----+----+---+---+---+ bits : |31-11| 10 | 9 |8-7|6-4|3-0| +-----+----+----+---+---+---+ field : | a | b | c | d | e | f | +-----+----+----+---+---+---+ a : not-used b : 1=gigabit c : 0=non-redundant, 1=redundant d : 0=short-haul, 1=long-haul, 2=extra-distance, e : 0=work-group(f200 & f800) 1=back-bone(f600 & f1200), f : 1=1-port, 2=2-port, 4=4-port

rcCardSerialNumber.name: rcCardSerialNumber
rcCardSerialNumber.description: Unique serial number for this card.

rcCardAdminStatus.name: rcCardAdminStatus
rcCardAdminStatus.description: Used to indicate the administrative status of this card

rcCardOperStatus.name: rcCardOperStatus
rcCardOperStatus.description: Used to indicate the operational status of this card.

rcCardPCMCIAType.name: rcCardPCMCIAType
rcCardPCMCIAType.description: Used to indicate the type of PCMCIA card currently installed in this CPU card, if any. For non-CPU cards, this variable has no meaning and will always be set to none.

rcPortEntry.name: rcPortEntry
rcPortEntry.description: Entry containing info. for a particular port

rcPortIndex.name: rcPortIndex
rcPortIndex.description: An index value that uniquely identifies a port. This value is similar to ifIndex in MIB2.

rcPortConnectorType.name: rcPortConnectorType
rcPortConnectorType.description: Type of connector installed on this port.

rcPortPerformRouting.name: rcPortPerformRouting
rcPortPerformRouting.description: Indicate whether this port should perform routing

rcPortHighPriority.name: rcPortHighPriority
rcPortHighPriority.description: Indicate whether this port should treated with high priority

rcPortResult.name: rcPortResult
rcPortResult.description: Result from the last Vlan action.

rcPortPrimaryConnector.name: rcPortPrimaryConnector
rcPortPrimaryConnector.description: For ports configured with redundant connectors, this value is used to indicate which connector should be used as the 'active' connector on this port the next time the port is placed into the ifAdminStatus=Up.

rcPortActiveConnector.name: rcPortActiveConnector
rcPortActiveConnector.description: For ports configured with redundant connectors, this value is used to indicate which connector is currently the active one. Only one connector can be active an anytime.

rcPortBackupConnectorStatus.name: rcPortBackupConnectorStatus
rcPortBackupConnectorStatus.description: Indicate the status of the link attached to the back-up (non-active) connector.

rcPortAutoNegotiate.name: rcPortAutoNegotiate
rcPortAutoNegotiate.description: Indicate whether this port enabled for auto negotiations or not.

rcPortOperDuplex.name: rcPortOperDuplex
rcPortOperDuplex.description: Indicate this port's current duplex value.

rcPortOperSpeed.name: rcPortOperSpeed
rcPortOperSpeed.description: Indicate this port's current speed value.

rcPortMltId.name: rcPortMltId
rcPortMltId.description: Indicate which multi-link trunk (MLT) this port is assigned to. If this port is not associated with any MLT, this value will be set to zero(0).

rcPortLocked.name: rcPortLocked
rcPortLocked.description: Indicate whether this port is locked.

rcPortAutoNegotiationSupported.name: rcPortAutoNegotiationSupported
rcPortAutoNegotiationSupported.description: Indicate whether this port can support auto-negotiation.

rcPortSingleRoutablePort.name: rcPortSingleRoutablePort
rcPortSingleRoutablePort.description: Indicate whether this port is a single routable port. If this value is true, the port functions like a traditional router port.

rcPortUnknownMacDiscard.name: rcPortUnknownMacDiscard
rcPortUnknownMacDiscard.description: If rcUnknownMacDiscard is set to True, then a packet with an unknown source MAC address is dropped on that port, and other ports then will discard any packets with this MAC address in the destination field. For example, suppose 11:22:33:44:55:66 is an unknown source MAC, packets with source MAC 11:22:33:44:55 coming from this port is discarded, further more, packets with destination MAC 11:22:33:44:55:66 coming from other ports are also discarded, unless this address is later learned on another port or the restriction ages out.

rcPortLockEnable.name: rcPortLockEnable
rcPortLockEnable.description: Indicate whether the port lock feature is enabled.

rcPortLockLockedPorts.name: rcPortLockLockedPorts
rcPortLockLockedPorts.description: The set of ports that are administratively locked. Locked ports cannot be modified in anyway until the port is unlocked first.

rcChasAruMode.name: rcChasAruMode
rcChasAruMode.description: The ARU mode the chassis is operating in.

rcChasQuidMode.name: rcChasQuidMode
rcChasQuidMode.description: The Quid mode the chassis is operating in.

rcAtmPortLecExtTable.name: rcAtmPortLecExtTable
rcAtmPortLecExtTable.description: An extension to the rcPort table used manage ATM specific options.

rcAtmPortLecExtIfIndex.name: rcAtmPortLecExtIfIndex
rcAtmPortLecExtIfIndex.description: An index value used to identify a LEC instance. Each LEC is treated as a logical port. Therefore each LEC has a unique row in the 'ifTable' and 'rcPort' tables.

rcAtmPortLecExtLecState.name: rcAtmPortLecExtLecState
rcAtmPortLecExtLecState.description: Reflects the current state of the LEC.

rcAtmPortLecExtVirtualPortId.name: rcAtmPortLecExtVirtualPortId
rcAtmPortLecExtVirtualPortId.description: Reflects the virtual port mapping of the LEC.

rcAtmPortLecExtElanName.name: rcAtmPortLecExtElanName
rcAtmPortLecExtElanName.description: The ELAN Name this client will use the next time it returns to the Initial State.

rcAtmPortLecExtVlanId.name: rcAtmPortLecExtVlanId
rcAtmPortLecExtVlanId.description: Reflects the VLAN Id membership of the LEC. 0 indicated no membership.

rcAtmPortLecExtDesiredPhysicalPort.name: rcAtmPortLecExtDesiredPhysicalPort
rcAtmPortLecExtDesiredPhysicalPort.description: Used to configure the desired physical port this LEC instance should be associated with. Each LEC can only be associated with one physical port. A physical port can support one or more LEC instances. This object can only be written when the Lec's status (rcAtmPortLecExtLecStatus) is disabled.

rcAtmPortLecExtActualPhysicalPort.name: rcAtmPortLecExtActualPhysicalPort
rcAtmPortLecExtActualPhysicalPort.description: Used to display the actual physical port this LEC instance should be associated with. Each LEC can only be associated with one physical port. A physical port can support one or more LEC instances.

rcAtmPortLecExtFailoverEnable.name: rcAtmPortLecExtFailoverEnable
rcAtmPortLecExtFailoverEnable.description: Used to configure whether the fail-over feature should be enabled/disabled for this LEC instance. Failover allows traffic to be moved from a failing port to the other port if it is available. The rcAtmPortLecExtActualPhysicalPort object is used to identify which physical port is currently carrying a Lec's traffic, while the rcAtmPortLecExtDesiredPhysicalPort object is used to select a Lec's preferred port.

rcMirrorSaveConfig.name: rcMirrorSaveConfig
rcMirrorSaveConfig.description: Control whether Mirror configuration information should be saved to NVRAM so mirror settings can be automatically reinstalled after a system reboot. Setting rcMirrorSaveConfig to true does not immediately save the configuration information. The save happens when the rcSysAction variable is set to 'saveToNVRAM(4)'.

rcMirrorByPortEnable.name: rcMirrorByPortEnable
rcMirrorByPortEnable.description: Used to indicate whether the mirror by port feature is active. The system can only support mirroring on two ports. When this feature is active, all packets received on the port(s) specified by rcMirrorSrcPortOne and/or rcMirrorSrcPortTwo are copied to rcMirrorDstPort. The mirroring operation is non-intrusive.

rcMirrorByPortMirrorPort.name: rcMirrorByPortMirrorPort
rcMirrorByPortMirrorPort.description: The ifIndex of the port to forward mirrored frames to.

rcMirrorByPortEnableMirroredPortOne.name: rcMirrorByPortEnableMirroredPortOne
rcMirrorByPortEnableMirroredPortOne.description: Used to indicate whether the port specified in rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortOne should be mirrored.

rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortOne.name: rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortOne
rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortOne.description: The ifIndex of the port to be mirrored. That is, traffic received on this port will be sent to the mirror port.

rcMirrorByPortEnableMirroredPortTwo.name: rcMirrorByPortEnableMirroredPortTwo
rcMirrorByPortEnableMirroredPortTwo.description: Used to indicate whether the port specified in rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortTwo should be mirrored.

rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortTwo.name: rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortTwo
rcMirrorByPortMirroredPortTwo.description: The ifIndex of the port to be mirrored. That is, traffic received on this port will be sent to the mirror port.

rcIsolateUnconfigPorts.name: rcIsolateUnconfigPorts
rcIsolateUnconfigPorts.description: Used to indicate whether ports that are unconfigured should be assigned to the 'isolated' VLAN. Ports assigned to the 'isolated' VLAN can only communicate with the CP port. If this option is not specified, unconfigured ports will be assigned to the 'default' VLAN

rcUseFactorySettings.name: rcUseFactorySettings
rcUseFactorySettings.description: Used to indicate whether the system should ignore the configuration information stored in NVRAM when the system is booted.

rcHighPriorityMode.name: rcHighPriorityMode
rcHighPriorityMode.description: Used to indicate whether the system is configured to operate in a high priority mode. The switch can operate in either a 'best effort' or 'high priority' mode. In the 'best effort' setting, the maximum queue thresholds for the QUIDs are set to 768/768 buffers. In the 'high priority' mode the setting is 512/768. This means that in 'high priority' mode the normal priority queue can't have more than 512 buffers, while the high priority queue can have up to 768.

rcTblRmonStatSize.name: rcTblRmonStatSize
rcTblRmonStatSize.description: Used to indicate the current size of the RMON Statistic table.

rcTblRmonHistoryControlSize.name: rcTblRmonHistoryControlSize
rcTblRmonHistoryControlSize.description: Used to indicate the current size of the RMON History Control table.

rcTblRmonHistoryEnetSize.name: rcTblRmonHistoryEnetSize
rcTblRmonHistoryEnetSize.description: Used to indicate the current size of the RMON History Ethernet table.

rcTblRmonAlarmSize.name: rcTblRmonAlarmSize
rcTblRmonAlarmSize.description: Used to indicate the current size of the RMON Alarm table.

rcTblRmonEventSize.name: rcTblRmonEventSize
rcTblRmonEventSize.description: Used to indicate the current size of the RMON Event table.

rcTblRmonLogSize.name: rcTblRmonLogSize
rcTblRmonLogSize.description: Used to indicate the current size of the RMON Log table.

rcTblArTblSize.name: rcTblArTblSize
rcTblArTblSize.description: Used to indicate the size of the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArFree.name: rcTblArFree
rcTblArFree.description: Used to indicate the number of free entries that are available in the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArNoSpace.name: rcTblArNoSpace
rcTblArNoSpace.description: Used to indicate the number of entries that could not be added to the Address Translation (AR) table due to lack of space.

rcTblArAdded.name: rcTblArAdded
rcTblArAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of entries added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArDeleted.name: rcTblArDeleted
rcTblArDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of entries deleted to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArMacAdded.name: rcTblArMacAdded
rcTblArMacAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of MAC entries added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArMacDeleted.name: rcTblArMacDeleted
rcTblArMacDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of MAC entries deleted to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArMacMoved.name: rcTblArMacMoved
rcTblArMacMoved.description: Used to indicate the number of MAC entries moved in the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArIpAdded.name: rcTblArIpAdded
rcTblArIpAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of IP entries added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArIpDeleted.name: rcTblArIpDeleted
rcTblArIpDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of IP entries deleted to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArMcastTblSize.name: rcTblArMcastTblSize
rcTblArMcastTblSize.description: Used to indicate the size of the Multicast Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArFreeMcastGroups.name: rcTblArFreeMcastGroups
rcTblArFreeMcastGroups.description: Used to indicate the number of free multicast groups availabe in the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArIpMcastAdded.name: rcTblArIpMcastAdded
rcTblArIpMcastAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of Ip multicast entries that are added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArIpMcastDeleted.name: rcTblArIpMcastDeleted
rcTblArIpMcastDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of Ip multicast entries that are deleted from the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArVlanByPortAdded.name: rcTblArVlanByPortAdded
rcTblArVlanByPortAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of VLAN by port entries that are added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArVlanByPortDeleted.name: rcTblArVlanByPortDeleted
rcTblArVlanByPortDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of VLAN by port entries that are deleted from the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArVlanByProtocolAdded.name: rcTblArVlanByProtocolAdded
rcTblArVlanByProtocolAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of Vlans by Protocol Type entries that are added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArVlanByProtocolDeleted.name: rcTblArVlanByProtocolDeleted
rcTblArVlanByProtocolDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of Vlans by Protocol Type entries that are deleted from the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArVlanByIpSubnetAdded.name: rcTblArVlanByIpSubnetAdded
rcTblArVlanByIpSubnetAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of VLAN by Ip entries that are added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArVlanByIpSubnetDeleted.name: rcTblArVlanByIpSubnetDeleted
rcTblArVlanByIpSubnetDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of VLAN by Ip entries that are deleted from the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArIpSubnetsAdded.name: rcTblArIpSubnetsAdded
rcTblArIpSubnetsAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of Ip subnet entries that are added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArIpSubnetsDeleted.name: rcTblArIpSubnetsDeleted
rcTblArIpSubnetsDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of Ip subnet entries that are deleted from the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArRsvpsAdded.name: rcTblArRsvpsAdded
rcTblArRsvpsAdded.description: Used to indicate the number of RSVP entries that are added to the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblArRsvpsDeleted.name: rcTblArRsvpsDeleted
rcTblArRsvpsDeleted.description: Used to indicate the number of RSVP entries that are deleted from the Address Translation (AR) table.

rcTblBrdgFdbSize.name: rcTblBrdgFdbSize
rcTblBrdgFdbSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the dot1d forwarding database table.

rcTblBrdgStaticSize.name: rcTblBrdgStaticSize
rcTblBrdgStaticSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the dot1d Static Address Filtering table.

rcTblIpAddrSize.name: rcTblIpAddrSize
rcTblIpAddrSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the IP Address table.

rcTblIpForwardingSize.name: rcTblIpForwardingSize
rcTblIpForwardingSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the IP Forwarding table.

rcTblIpNetToMediaSize.name: rcTblIpNetToMediaSize
rcTblIpNetToMediaSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the IP Net-to-media table.

rcIpConfTable.name: rcIpConfTable
rcIpConfTable.description: A table used to maintain IP routing information for a particular interface.

rcIpConfEntry.name: rcIpConfEntry
rcIpConfEntry.description: Entry containing IP routing information. An entry is automatically created in this table when routing is enabled for an interface -or- when an ip address is configured on an interface.

rcIpConfIfIndex.name: rcIpConfIfIndex
rcIpConfIfIndex.description: An unique value to identify a physical interface or a logical interface (VLAN).

rcIpConfAdvertDefRte.name: rcIpConfAdvertDefRte
rcIpConfAdvertDefRte.description: Used to indicate whether this interface should advertize a RIP default route.

rcIpConfAcceptDefRte.name: rcIpConfAcceptDefRte
rcIpConfAcceptDefRte.description: Used to indicate whether this interface should accept a RIP default route.

rcIpConfRipEnable.name: rcIpConfRipEnable
rcIpConfRipEnable.description: Enable or disable RIP routing on the specified interface.

rcIpConfOspfEnable.name: rcIpConfOspfEnable
rcIpConfOspfEnable.description: Enable or disable OSPF routing on the specified interface.

rcIpConfIgmpEnable.name: rcIpConfIgmpEnable
rcIpConfIgmpEnable.description: Enable or disable IGMP on the specified interface.

rcIpConfAddrAssigned.name: rcIpConfAddrAssigned
rcIpConfAddrAssigned.description: Indicate whether IpAddress has been assigned for this interface.

rcIpConfDhcpEnable.name: rcIpConfDhcpEnable
rcIpConfDhcpEnable.description: Enable or disable DHCP on the specified interface.

rcIpConfTriggeredUpdateEnable.name: rcIpConfTriggeredUpdateEnable
rcIpConfTriggeredUpdateEnable.description: Used to indicate whether the RIP triggered update feature should be enabled on this interface.

rcIpConfRipAutoAggrerateEnable.name: rcIpConfRipAutoAggrerateEnable
rcIpConfRipAutoAggrerateEnable.description: Used to indicate whether the auto aggregation feature should be enabled on this interface.

rcIpConfRipGenerateDefaultRoute.name: rcIpConfRipGenerateDefaultRoute
rcIpConfRipGenerateDefaultRoute.description: Used to indicate whether to generate a default RIP route on this interface.

rcIpConfOspfTable.name: rcIpConfOspfTable
rcIpConfOspfTable.description: A table used to maintain OSPF information for a particular interface.

rcIpConfOspfEntry.name: rcIpConfOspfEntry
rcIpConfOspfEntry.description: Entry containing OSPF information. An entry is automatically created in this table when routing is enabled for an interface -or- when an ip address is configured on an interface.

rcIpConfOspfIfIndex.name: rcIpConfOspfIfIndex
rcIpConfOspfIfIndex.description: An unique value to identify a physical interface or a logical interface (VLAN).

rcIpConfOspfRtrPriority.name: rcIpConfOspfRtrPriority
rcIpConfOspfRtrPriority.description: The priority of this interface. Used in multi- access networks, this field is used in the designated router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the router is not eligible to become the designated router on this particular network. In the event of a tie in this value, routers will use their router id as a tie breaker.

rcIpConfOspfMetric.name: rcIpConfOspfMetric
rcIpConfOspfMetric.description: The metric for this type of service (TOS) on this interface. The default value of the TOS 0 Metric is (10^9 / ifSpeed). The value FFFF means 'no route via this TOS'. A value of 0 means the interface speed (rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric) will be used as metric value, when the state of the interface is up.

rcIpConfOspfAuthKey.name: rcIpConfOspfAuthKey
rcIpConfOspfAuthKey.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 9 The Interface Data Structure
rcIpConfOspfAuthKey.description: The Authentication Key. If the Area's Authorization Type is simplePassword, and the key length is shorter than 8 octets, the agent will left adjust and zero fill to 8 octets. When read, ospfIfAuthKey always returns an Octet String of length zero.

rcIpConfOspfHelloInterval.name: rcIpConfOspfHelloInterval
rcIpConfOspfHelloInterval.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the interface. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

rcIpConfOspfRtrDeadInterval.name: rcIpConfOspfRtrDeadInterval
rcIpConfOspfRtrDeadInterval.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before it's neighbors declare the router down. This should be some multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

rcIpConfOspfIfAreaId.name: rcIpConfOspfIfAreaId
rcIpConfOspfIfAreaId.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the area to which the interface connects. Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.

rcIpConfOspfAuthType.name: rcIpConfOspfAuthType
rcIpConfOspfAuthType.description: The authentication type specified for an interface. Additional authentication types may be assigned locally.

rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric10MegPort.name: rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric10MegPort
rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric10MegPort.description: Used to indicate the cost associated with 10Meg Interface(Port).

rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric100MegPort.name: rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric100MegPort
rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric100MegPort.description: Used to indicate the cost associated with 100Meg Interface(Port).

rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric1000MegPort.name: rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric1000MegPort
rcIpConfOspfDefaultMetric1000MegPort.description: Used to indicate the cost associated with 1000Meg Interface(Port).

rcIpConfOspfTrapEnable.name: rcIpConfOspfTrapEnable
rcIpConfOspfTrapEnable.description: Used to indicate whether Ospf Traps should be sent.

rcIpConfOspfAutoVirtLinkEnable.name: rcIpConfOspfAutoVirtLinkEnable
rcIpConfOspfAutoVirtLinkEnable.description: Used to indicate whether auto virtual link creation is enabled or not. If set to true OSPF will create virtual links between ABRs whether it is needed or not, but adjacency will established only when one of the ABR losses connection to backbone area. If set to false then it is user resposibity to create virtual link whenever needed.

rcIpConfOspfSpfHoldDownTime.name: rcIpConfOspfSpfHoldDownTime
rcIpConfOspfSpfHoldDownTime.description: The SPF Hold Down Timer value. The SPF will run at most once per hold down timer value.

rcIpConfGlobalRipHoldDownTime.name: rcIpConfGlobalRipHoldDownTime
rcIpConfGlobalRipHoldDownTime.description: Used to set the system-wide RIP hold down time in seconds.

rcIpConfOspfAreaTable.name: rcIpConfOspfAreaTable
rcIpConfOspfAreaTable.description: A table used to maintain OSPF information for a particular Area.

rcIpConfOspfAreaEntry.name: rcIpConfOspfAreaEntry
rcIpConfOspfAreaEntry.description: Entry containing OSPF Area configuration information. An entry is automatically created in this table when an area is configured through ospfAreaTable in (rfc1253rcc.mib).

rcIpConfOspfAreaId.name: rcIpConfOspfAreaId
rcIpConfOspfAreaId.description: An unique value to identify an area. Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.

rcIpConfOspfAreaImportSummary.name: rcIpConfOspfAreaImportSummary
rcIpConfOspfAreaImportSummary.description: The area's support for importing Summary advertisements into a stub area. This field should be used only if ospfImportASExtern is set to FALSE

rcIpConfOspfAreaActiveIfCount.name: rcIpConfOspfAreaActiveIfCount
rcIpConfOspfAreaActiveIfCount.description: This variable displays the number of active interfaces configured in this area. An area cannot be deleted if this value is > 0.

rcIpAddrTable.name: rcIpAddrTable
rcIpAddrTable.description: The table of addressing information relevant to this entity's IP addresses. This table is identical to the ipAddrTable in MIB2 except the columns rcIpAdEntIfIndex and rcIpAdEntAddr are reversed. Also, the table is indexed by both these variables.

rcIpAddrEntry.name: rcIpAddrEntry
rcIpAddrEntry.description: The addressing information for one of this entity's IP addresses.

rcIpAdEntIfIndex.name: rcIpAdEntIfIndex
rcIpAdEntIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

rcIpAdEntAddr.name: rcIpAdEntAddr
rcIpAdEntAddr.description: The IP address to which this entry's addressing information pertains.

rcIpAdEntNetMask.name: rcIpAdEntNetMask
rcIpAdEntNetMask.description: The subnet mask associated with the IP address of this entry. The value of the mask is an IP address with all the network bits set to 1 and all the hosts bits set to 0.

rcIpAdEntBcastAddrFormat.name: rcIpAdEntBcastAddrFormat
rcIpAdEntBcastAddrFormat.description: The IP broadcast address format used on this interface.

rcIpAdEntReasmMaxSize.name: rcIpAdEntReasmMaxSize
rcIpAdEntReasmMaxSize.description: The size of the largest IP datagram which this entity can re-assemble from incoming IP fragmented datagrams received on this interface.

rcIpFlowTable.name: rcIpFlowTable
rcIpFlowTable.description: IpFlow Table. This table contain entries that correspond to RSVP records in the switching fabric Address Resolution table. A connection that has a matching entry in this table will be processed with a higher priority than connections that do not have an entry.

rcIpFlowSrcIpAddress.name: rcIpFlowSrcIpAddress
rcIpFlowSrcIpAddress.description: The source IP address of an IP packet.

rcIpFlowSrcIpPort.name: rcIpFlowSrcIpPort
rcIpFlowSrcIpPort.description: The source port of an IP packet. A zero value in this field is used as a wildcard value.

rcIpFlowDstIpAddress.name: rcIpFlowDstIpAddress
rcIpFlowDstIpAddress.description: The destination IP address of an IP packet.

rcIpFlowDstIpPort.name: rcIpFlowDstIpPort
rcIpFlowDstIpPort.description: The destination port of an IP packet. A zero value in this field is used as a wildcard value.

rcIpFlowProtocol.name: rcIpFlowProtocol
rcIpFlowProtocol.description: The protocol type of an IP packet. A zero value in this field is used as a wildcard value.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfEnable.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfEnable
rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfEnable.description: Used to indicate whether or not to Redistribute RIP routes to OSPF.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfExplicit.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfExplicitMetric
rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfExplicit.description: Value of metric that is used to translate the RIP route to OSPF.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfUseExpli.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfUseExplicitMetric
rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfUseExpli.description: Used to indicate whether or not to use the user specified default metric for redistributing RIP routes to OSPF.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfExternal.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfExternalMetricType
rcIpRoutingRedistributeRipToOspfExternal.description: Used to configure the metric type of the distributed routes to OSPF domain. type1 means the metric is comparable directly to the link state metric (cost = internal cost + external cost). type2 means the metric is considered larger than any link state metric (cost = external cost).

rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipEnable.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipEnable
rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipEnable.description: Used to indicate whether or not to redistribute OSPF routes to RIP.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipExplicit.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipExplicitMetric
rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipExplicit.description: Value of metric that is used to translate the OSPF route to RIP.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipUseExpli.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipUseExplicitMetric
rcIpRoutingRedistributeOspfToRipUseExpli.description: Used to indicate whether or not to use the user specified default metric for redistributing OSPF routes to RIP.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfEnabl.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfEnable
rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfEnabl.description: Used to indicate whether directly connected networks through non-ospf interfaces are distributed to OSPF database or not. If set to true all the static routes will be added as external routes to OSPF routing domain, provided the router is configured as AS Border router. Also originates asExtern link LSA.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfMetho.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfMethod
rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfMetho.description: Used to indicate whether or not to use the user specified default metric for redistributing direct routes to OSPF.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfExpli.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfExplicitMetric
rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfExpli.description: Value of metric that is used to translate the routes to directly connected networks to OSPF.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfExter.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfExternalMetricType
rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToOspfExter.description: Used to configure the metric type of the distributed routes to OSPF domain. type1 means the metric is comparable directly to the link state metric (cost = internal cost + external cost). type2 means the metric is considered larger than any link state metric (cost = external cost).

rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfEnabl.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfEnable
rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfEnabl.description: Used to indicate whether static routes (that are configured locally through management protocol) are distributed to OSPF database or not. If set to true all the static routes will be added as external routes to OSPF routing domain, provided the router is configured as AS Border router. Also originates asExtern link LSA.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfExpli.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfExplicitMetric
rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfExpli.description: Value of metric that is used to translate the static routes to OSPF.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfUseEx.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfUseExplicitMetric
rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfUseEx.description: Used to indicate whether or not to use the user specified default metric for redistributing static routes to OSPF.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfExter.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfExternalMetricType
rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfExter.description: Used to configure the metric type of the distributed routes to OSPF domain. type1 means the metric is comparable directly to the link state metric (cost = internal cost + external cost). type2 means the metric is considered larger than any link state metric (cost = external cost).

rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfAdver.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfAdvertDefRte
rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToOspfAdver.description: Used to indicate whether default route (that are configured locally through management protocol) should be distributed to OSPF database or not. If set to true then the default route will be added as external route to OSPF routing domain, provided the router is configured as AS Border router. Also originates asExtern link LSA.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToRipEnable.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToRipEnable
rcIpRoutingRedistributeDirectToRipEnable.description: Used to indicate whether directly connected networks through non-rip interfaces are distributed to RIP or not.

rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToRipEnable.name: rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToRipEnable
rcIpRoutingRedistributeStaticToRipEnable.description: Used to indicate whether static routes (that are configured locally through management protocol) are distributed to RIP database or not. If set to true all the static routes will be added as external routes to RIP routing domain.

rcIpConfIgmpTable.name: rcIpConfIgmpTable
rcIpConfIgmpTable.description: A table used to maintain IGMP information for a particular interface.

rcIpConfIgmpEntry.name: rcIpConfIgmpEntry
rcIpConfIgmpEntry.description: Entry containing IGMP information. An entry is automatically created in this table when routing is enabled for an interface -or- when an ip address is configured on an interface.

rcIpConfIgmpIfIndex.name: rcIpConfIgmpIfIndex
rcIpConfIgmpIfIndex.description: An unique value to identify a physical interface or a logical interface (VLAN).

rcIpConfIgmpQueryInterval.name: rcIpConfIgmpQueryInterval
rcIpConfIgmpQueryInterval.description: The frequency at which IGMP Host-Query packets are transmitted on this interface.

rcIpConfIgmpVersion.name: rcIpConfIgmpVersion
rcIpConfIgmpVersion.description: The version of IGMP which is running on this interface. This object can be used to configure a router capable of running either value. For IGMP to function correctly, all routers on a LAN must be configured to run the same version of IGMP on that LAN.

rcIpConfIgmpQueryMaxResponseTime.name: rcIpConfIgmpQueryMaxResponseTime
rcIpConfIgmpQueryMaxResponseTime.description: The maximum query response time advertised in IGMPv2 queries on this interface. Smaller values allow a router to prune groups faster.

rcIpConfIgmpQuerierPresentTimeout.name: rcIpConfIgmpQuerierPresentTimeout
rcIpConfIgmpQuerierPresentTimeout.description: A timeout interval. If no IGMPv2 queries are heard on this interface within this timeout interval, the local router will take over the Querier on the IP subnet to which this interface is attached.

rcIpConfIgmpLeaveEnabled.name: rcIpConfIgmpLeaveEnabled
rcIpConfIgmpLeaveEnabled.description: An indication of whether the processing of IGMPv2 Leave messages is enabled on this interface.

rcIgmpGroupTable.name: rcIgmpGroupTable
rcIgmpGroupTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the multicast groups configured in the device.

rcIgmpGroupEntry.name: rcIgmpGroupEntry
rcIgmpGroupEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) representing an Igmp group.

rcIgmpGroupIpAddress.name: rcIgmpGroupIpAddress
rcIgmpGroupIpAddress.description: Multicast group Address (Class D) that others want to join. A group address can be the same for many incoming ports.

rcIgmpGroupMembers.name: rcIgmpGroupMembers
rcIgmpGroupMembers.description: IP Address of a source that has sent group report wishing to join this group.

rcIgmpGroupInPort.name: rcIgmpGroupInPort
rcIgmpGroupInPort.description: An unique value to identify a physical interface or a logical interface (VLAN), which has received Group reports from various sources.

rcIgmpGroupExpiration.name: rcIgmpGroupExpiration
rcIgmpGroupExpiration.description: Time left before the group report expired on this port. Only one of this variable port. This variable is updated upon receiving a group report.

rcIpRouteEntry.name: rcIpRouteEntry
rcIpRouteEntry.description: A route to a particular destination.

rcIpRouteDest.name: rcIpRouteDest
rcIpRouteDest.description: The destination IP address of this route. An entry with a value of 0.0.0.0 is considered a default route. Multiple routes to a single destination can appear in the table, but access to such multiple entries is dependent on the table- access mechanisms defined by the network management protocol in use.

rcIpRouteMask.name: rcIpRouteMask
rcIpRouteMask.description: Indicate the mask to be logical-ANDed with the destination address before being compared to the value in the rcIpRouteDest field. For those systems that do not support arbitrary subnet masks, an agent constructs the value of the rcIpRouteMask by determining whether the value of the correspondent rcIpRouteDest field belong to a class-A, B, or C network, and then using one of: mask network 255.0.0.0 class-A 255.255.0.0 class-B 255.255.255.0 class-C If the value of the rcIpRouteDest is 0.0.0.0 (a default route), then the mask value is also 0.0.0.0. It should be noted that all IP routing subsystems implicitly use this mechanism.

rcIpRouteNextHop.name: rcIpRouteNextHop
rcIpRouteNextHop.description: The IP address of the next hop of this route. (In the case of a route bound to an interface which is realized via a broadcast media, the value of this field is the agent's IP address on that interface).

rcIpRouteMetric.name: rcIpRouteMetric
rcIpRouteMetric.description: The primary routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's rcIpRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

rcIpRouteIfIndex.name: rcIpRouteIfIndex
rcIpRouteIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

rcIpRouteType.name: rcIpRouteType
rcIpRouteType.description: The type of route. Note that the values direct(3) and indirect(4) refer to the notion of direct and indirect routing in the IP architecture.

rcIpRouteProto.name: rcIpRouteProto
rcIpRouteProto.description: The routing mechanism via which this route was learned. Inclusion of values for gateway routing protocols is not intended to imply that hosts should support those protocols.

rcIpRouteAge.name: rcIpRouteAge
rcIpRouteAge.description: The number of seconds since this route was last updated or otherwise determined to be correct. Note that no semantics of `too old' can be implied except through knowledge of the routing protocol by which the route was learned.

rcIpConfDhcpEntry.name: rcIpConfDhcpEntry
rcIpConfDhcpEntry.description: Used to configure DHCP on a particular port. An entry is created automatically when the variable rcIpConfDhcpEnable is set to TRUE. Once created this entry will only be deleted if the rcIpConfDhcpRowStatus is set to 'destroy(6)'. In which case, the rcIpConfDhcpEnable is automatically reset to the FALSE setting.

rcIpConfDhcpIfIndex.name: rcIpConfDhcpIfIndex
rcIpConfDhcpIfIndex.description: Interface number. The number can represent either a physical or logical(VLAN) interface.

rcIpConfDhcpMaxHop.name: rcIpConfDhcpMaxHop
rcIpConfDhcpMaxHop.description: Used to indicate the maximum number of hops a DHCP packet can take from the source device to the destination device (i.e., DHCP client to DHCP server).

rcIpConfDhcpMinSec.name: rcIpConfDhcpMinSec
rcIpConfDhcpMinSec.description: Used to indicate the minimum number of seconds to wait between receiving a DHCP packet and actually forwarding the DHCP packet to the destination device. A value of zero(0) indicates forwarding should be done immediately without any delay.

rcIpConfDhcpMode.name: rcIpConfDhcpMode
rcIpConfDhcpMode.description: Used to indicate what type of DHCP packets this interface should support. A value of none(1) will result in all incoming DHCP and BOOTP packets to be dropped.

rcIpConfDhcpRowStatus.name: rcIpConfDhcpRowStatus
rcIpConfDhcpRowStatus.description: An entry is created automatically when the variable rcIpConfDhcpEnable is set to TRUE. Once created this entry will only be deleted if the rcIpConfDhcpRowStatus is set to 'destroy(6)'. In which case, the rcIpConfDhcpEnable is automatically reset to the FALSE setting.

rcIpConfDhcpNumRequests.name: rcIpConfDhcpNumRequests
rcIpConfDhcpNumRequests.description: The total number of DHCP requests seen on this interface.

rcIpConfDhcpNumReplies.name: rcIpConfDhcpNumReplies
rcIpConfDhcpNumReplies.description: The total number of DHCP replies seen on this interface.

rcIpConfDhcpAlwaysBroadcast.name: rcIpConfDhcpAlwaysBroadcast
rcIpConfDhcpAlwaysBroadcast.description: Used to indicate if DHCP Reply packets should be broadcast to the DHCP client on this interface.

rcIpDhcpForwardEntry.name: rcIpDhcpForwardEntry
rcIpDhcpForwardEntry.description: An entry used represents a DHCP forwarding directive.

rcIpDhcpForwardAgentAddr.name: rcIpDhcpForwardAgentAddr
rcIpDhcpForwardAgentAddr.description: The IP address configured on an interface (i.e., a locally configured IP address).

rcIpDhcpForwardServerAddr.name: rcIpDhcpForwardServerAddr
rcIpDhcpForwardServerAddr.description: The IP address of the DHCP server. If this IP address corresponds to a locally configured IP network, the DHCP packet is broadcasted out the interface the IP address is assigned to. This behavior is known as 'relay agent' mode. If this IP address is a remote address, the DHCP packet is sent via unicast to the remote device. This behavior is known as 'preferred server' mode.

rcIpDhcpForwardEnable.name: rcIpDhcpForwardEnable
rcIpDhcpForwardEnable.description: Used to indicate whether is entry should be used.

rcIpDhcpForwardMode.name: rcIpDhcpForwardMode
rcIpDhcpForwardMode.description: Used to indicate whether this entry pertains to BOOTP packets, DHCP packets, or both.

rcIpFilterFilterTableSize.name: rcIpFilterFilterTableSize
rcIpFilterFilterTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpFilterTable.

rcIpFilterGlobalListTableSize.name: rcIpFilterGlobalListTableSize
rcIpFilterGlobalListTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpFilterGlobalListTable.

rcIpFilterBaseListTableSize.name: rcIpFilterBaseListTableSize
rcIpFilterBaseListTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpFilterBaseListTable.

rcIpFilterPortTableSize.name: rcIpFilterPortTableSize
rcIpFilterPortTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpFilterPortTable.

rcIpFilterNextAvailFilterId.name: rcIpFilterNextAvailFilterId
rcIpFilterNextAvailFilterId.description: next available filter-id in the rcIpFilterPortTable.

rcIpFilterEntry.name: rcIpFilterEntry
rcIpFilterEntry.description: IP filter attributes. The system supports a vast array of filter options. Each of these options are supported in this entry. If a particular option is not used, the column should be set to zero.

rcIpFilterType.name: rcIpFilterType
rcIpFilterType.description: Used to indicate a particular type of filter. A 'global' filter is a filter that is applied to all packets irregardless of the packet's source or destination IP address. A 'destination' filter is used to match the destination IP address field of incoming packets. When a match is found, this filter is applied to the packet. A 'source' filter is used to match the source IP address field of incoming packets. When a match is found, this filter is applied to the packet.

rcIpFilterDstAddr.name: rcIpFilterDstAddr
rcIpFilterDstAddr.description: Destination IP address to filter on.

rcIpFilterDstMask.name: rcIpFilterDstMask
rcIpFilterDstMask.description: Destination IP subnet mask to filter on.

rcIpFilterSrcAddr.name: rcIpFilterSrcAddr
rcIpFilterSrcAddr.description: Source IP address to filter on.

rcIpFilterSrcMask.name: rcIpFilterSrcMask
rcIpFilterSrcMask.description: Source IP subnet mask to filter on.

rcIpFilterId.name: rcIpFilterId
rcIpFilterId.description: This filter's unique identifier(id). This id is automatically generated by the system when a filter is created. This id is used in the 'rcIpFilterGlobalListTable' and 'rcIpFilterBaseListTable' when grouping one or more filters into a filter list.

rcIpFilterProtocolType.name: rcIpFilterProtocolType
rcIpFilterProtocolType.description: Type of protocol to filter on.

rcIpFilterSrcPort.name: rcIpFilterSrcPort
rcIpFilterSrcPort.description: TCP/UDP source port to filter on.

rcIpFilterSrcOption.name: rcIpFilterSrcOption
rcIpFilterSrcOption.description: Type of matching to perform on the field 'rcIpFilterSrcPort'. For 'source' and 'destination' filters, this value can only be 'equal(1)'.

rcIpFilterDstPort.name: rcIpFilterDstPort
rcIpFilterDstPort.description: TCP/UDP destination port to filter on.

rcIpFilterDstOption.name: rcIpFilterDstOption
rcIpFilterDstOption.description: Type of matching to perform on the field 'rcIpFilterDstPort'. For 'source' and 'destination' filters, this value can only be 'equal(1)'.

rcIpFilterCopyToCpu.name: rcIpFilterCopyToCpu
rcIpFilterCopyToCpu.description: Used to specify whether a packet matching this filter should be copied to the CPU.

rcIpFilterMirror.name: rcIpFilterMirror
rcIpFilterMirror.description: Used to specify whether a packet matching this filter should be mirrored to the port specified by 'rcMirrorByPortMirrorPort'.

rcIpFilterHighPriority.name: rcIpFilterHighPriority
rcIpFilterHighPriority.description: Used to specify whether a packet matching this filter should be forwarded with high priority.

rcIpFilterTcpConnect.name: rcIpFilterTcpConnect
rcIpFilterTcpConnect.description: Used to specify whether a TCP packet matching this filter should be accepted. Pass only those matching TCP packets with either the ACK bit or RST bit set. Apply only if the IP Protocol is set to TCP.

rcIpFilterIeeeVlanPriority.name: rcIpFilterIeeeVlanPriority
rcIpFilterIeeeVlanPriority.description: Used to specify the priority bits for explicit IEEE VLAN tag for a packet matching this filter. If this priority bit field is greater than the priority field currently in the IEEE tag in the Packet Header, this priority field will be loaded into the Packet Header.

rcIpFilterUsePktLimit.name: rcIpFilterUsePktLimit
rcIpFilterUsePktLimit.description: Used to specify whether the 'rcIpFilterPktLimit' field in this entry should be used when applying this filter.

rcIpFilterPktLimit.name: rcIpFilterPktLimit
rcIpFilterPktLimit.description: The maximum packet size limit to filter against.

rcIpFilterMode.name: rcIpFilterMode
rcIpFilterMode.description: Used to specify the operation mode for this entry. 'useDefaultAction' means use the setting specified in the 'rcIpFilterPortDefaultAction' variable. 'forward' means forward the packet if the packet satisfies this policy. 'drop' means drop the packet if the packet satisfies this policy. This variable setting has higher precedence than the setting in 'rcIpFilterPortDefaultAction'.

rcIpFilterGlobalListTable.name: rcIpFilterGlobalListTable
rcIpFilterGlobalListTable.description: A table used to store global filter list information. Each row in the table contains a set of individual filters that make up a particular filter list.

rcIpFilterGlobalListId.name: rcIpFilterGlobalListId
rcIpFilterGlobalListId.description: An unique value to identify a particular global filter list.

rcIpFilterGlobalListFilterIdListSize.name: rcIpFilterGlobalListFilterIdListSize
rcIpFilterGlobalListFilterIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of filters are associated with this filter list.

rcIpFilterGlobalListFilterIdList.name: rcIpFilterGlobalListFilterIdList
rcIpFilterGlobalListFilterIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more filters that are associated with this filter list. Each filter identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpFilterBaseListTable.name: rcIpFilterBaseListTable
rcIpFilterBaseListTable.description: A table used to store base filter list information. Each row in the table contains a set of individual filters that make up a particular filter list.

rcIpFilterBaseListId.name: rcIpFilterBaseListId
rcIpFilterBaseListId.description: An unique value to identify a particular base filter list.

rcIpFilterBaseListFilterIdListSize.name: rcIpFilterBaseListFilterIdListSize
rcIpFilterBaseListFilterIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of filters are associated with this filter list.

rcIpFilterBaseListFilterIdList.name: rcIpFilterBaseListFilterIdList
rcIpFilterBaseListFilterIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more filters that are associated with this filter list. Each filter identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpFilterPortTable.name: rcIpFilterPortTable
rcIpFilterPortTable.description: A table used to store port filtering information.

rcIpFilterPortIfIndex.name: rcIpFilterPortIfIndex
rcIpFilterPortIfIndex.description: IfIndex value of a port where filtering is applied.

rcIpFilterPortFilterListSize.name: rcIpFilterPortFilterListSize
rcIpFilterPortFilterListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of filter list(s) that are assigned to this port.

rcIpFilterPortFilterList.name: rcIpFilterPortFilterList
rcIpFilterPortFilterList.description: Used to indicate zero or more filter lists that are associated with this port. Each filter list identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpFilterPortMode.name: rcIpFilterPortMode
rcIpFilterPortMode.description: Used to indicate when filters applied to this port should be treated as 'permit' or 'deny' filters. When filters are not enabled on the port the mode is set to none. The port does not block any packet. Mode None cannot be used when PortEnable is true. On a port configured as 'permit', any packet that satisfies a filter is allowed to be forwarded. On a port configured as 'deny', any packet that satisfies a filter is dropped.

rcIpFilterPortEnable.name: rcIpFilterPortEnable
rcIpFilterPortEnable.description: Used to indicate whether filtering is configured on this port.

rcIpFilterPortDefaultAction.name: rcIpFilterPortDefaultAction
rcIpFilterPortDefaultAction.description: Used to indicate the default action that should be performed when an IP filter applies to a particular port. When filters are not enabled on the port the action is set to 'none' which means the port does not block any packet. 'none' cannot be used when PortEnable is true. On a port configured as 'forward', any packet that satisfies a filter is allowed to be forwarded. On a port configured as 'drop', any packet that satisfies a filter is dropped.

rcIpPolicyAddrTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyAddrTableSize
rcIpPolicyAddrTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyAddrTable.

rcIpPolicyAddrTable.name: rcIpPolicyAddrTable
rcIpPolicyAddrTable.description: A table used to store different types list entries. Each row in the table contains a list entry that is used by a set of announce policies.

rcIpPolicyAddrIpAddr.name: rcIpPolicyAddrIpAddr
rcIpPolicyAddrIpAddr.description: The network address for this type of list entry. This value is required for all types of lists.

rcIpPolicyAddrId.name: rcIpPolicyAddrId
rcIpPolicyAddrId.description: Identifier of this entry. Used internally to identify this entry.

rcIpPolicyAddrAddrListIdListSize.name: rcIpPolicyAddrAddrListIdListSize
rcIpPolicyAddrAddrListIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of id(s) in the rcIpPolicyAddrListIdList variable.

rcIpPolicyAddrAddrListIdList.name: rcIpPolicyAddrAddrListIdList
rcIpPolicyAddrAddrListIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more rcIpPolicyAddrListEntry(s) that are referring to this entry. Each list-id identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpPolicyNetTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyNetTableSize
rcIpPolicyNetTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyNetTable.

rcIpPolicyNetTable.name: rcIpPolicyNetTable
rcIpPolicyNetTable.description: A table used to store different types list entries. Each row in the table contains a list entry that is used by a set of announce policies.

rcIpPolicyNetAddr.name: rcIpPolicyNetAddr
rcIpPolicyNetAddr.description: The network address for this type of list entry. This value is required for all types of lists.

rcIpPolicyNetMask.name: rcIpPolicyNetMask
rcIpPolicyNetMask.description: The route mask for this type of list entry. This value is meaningful only if rcIpPolicyNetEntry is equal to exactNet(1), rangeNet(2), advertiseNet(3). For other types it should have the value 0.0.0.0.

rcIpPolicyNetId.name: rcIpPolicyNetId
rcIpPolicyNetId.description: Used internally to recognize this entry.

rcIpPolicyNetNetListIdListSize.name: rcIpPolicyNetNetListIdListSize
rcIpPolicyNetNetListIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of id(s) in the rcIpPolicyNetListIdList variable.

rcIpPolicyNetNetListIdList.name: rcIpPolicyNetNetListIdList
rcIpPolicyNetNetListIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more rcIpPolicyNetListEntry(s) that are referring to this entry. Each list-id identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpPolicyAddrListTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListTableSize
rcIpPolicyAddrListTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyAddrListTable.

rcIpPolicyAddrListTable.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListTable
rcIpPolicyAddrListTable.description: A table used to group rcIpPolicyAddrEntry(s) into a list.

rcIpPolicyAddrListId.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListId
rcIpPolicyAddrListId.description: A value that uniquely identifies this list of rcIpPolicyAddrListEntry.

rcIpPolicyAddrListName.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListName
rcIpPolicyAddrListName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this list.

rcIpPolicyAddrListIdListSize.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListIdListSize
rcIpPolicyAddrListIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of rcIpPolicyAddrNetEntry id(s) in the rcIpPolicyAddrListIdList variable.

rcIpPolicyAddrListIdList.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListIdList
rcIpPolicyAddrListIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more AddrListId that are associated to this list. Each AddrList identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpPolicyAddrListPolicyIdListSize.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListPolicyIdListSize
rcIpPolicyAddrListPolicyIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of policy id(s) in the Policy Id list. That are referring to this list.

rcIpPolicyAddrListPolicyIdList.name: rcIpPolicyAddrListPolicyIdList
rcIpPolicyAddrListPolicyIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more policies that are referring to this entry. Each policy identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceTableSize
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceTable.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceTable.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceTable
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceTable.description: A table used to store set of announce policies configured for RIP routing protocol. The Number of entries is given by rcIpPolicyNumRipPolicies.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceEntry.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceEntry
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceEntry.description: Entry containing configuration information for a particular announce policy.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceId
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceId.description: A value that uniquely identifies the policy associated with this entry.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceName.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceName
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this policy.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceEnable.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceEnable
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceEnable.description: It indicates whether this policy is enabled or not. The policy should be applied only if it is set to 'true'.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceExactNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceExactNetListId
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceExactNetListId.description: Used to indicate the number of 'exact' type entries that are configured for this policy. An entry with type 'exactNet' or 'rangeNet' represents the network list. This indicates which networks will match a particular announce policy. An entry with a 'exact' type means to only match the specific network advertisement (netaddr & mask). An 'exact' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match the default route'. If set to '0', this policy applies to all the routes.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRangeNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRangeNetListId
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRangeNetListId.description: Used to indicate zero or more 'range' network entries that are associated with this policy. An entry with a 'range' type means to match any network number that falls in the range indicated by the addr & mask. A 'range' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match any route'. If set to '0', this policy applies to all the routes.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipGatewayListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipGatewayListId
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipGatewayListId.description: Used to identify the RIP-gatewayList in the list that are associated with this policy. This field has meaning only for RIP sourced routes and if RIP is included as a RouteSource. The list contains one or more rip-routers (other side of the interface) addresses that could send RIP updates to this router. If a router address is included in this list, this policy applies to RIP advertisements from that router. If set to '0', this policy applies to RIP updates received from any rip routers/interfaces.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipInterfaceListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipInterfaceListId
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipInterfaceListId.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the ripInterfaceIdList that are configured for this policy. This field has meaning only for RIP sourced routes and if RIP is included as a RouteSource. The list contains one or more rip-interface addresses on this router. If an interface address is incuded in this list, this policy applies to RIP advertisements received on that interface. A value of '0' indicates thtat this policy applies to RIP updates received on any rip-interface.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceOspfRouterListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceOspfRouterListId
