rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceOspfRouterListId.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the OspfRouteIds that are configured for this policy. This field has meaning only for OSPF sourced routes and if OSPF is included as a RouteSource. The list contains one or more router IDs of OSPF routers. If a routerId is included in this list, this policy applies to OSPF advertisements received from that router. A value of '0' indicates that this policy applies to any OPSF routes received from any router.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAnnounceInterfaceLi.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAnnounceInterfaceListId
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAnnounceInterfaceLi.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the AnnounceInterfaceids that are configured for this policy. The list contains one or more outbound interface addresses. If the outbound interface address in this list, the policy applies to RIP updates/advertisements sent through this interface. A value of '0' indicates that this policy applies to any outbound RIP interface on this router.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnouncePrecedence.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnouncePrecedence
rcIpPolicyRipAnnouncePrecedence.description: Is used while comparing this policy rule with other policy that a given route may match. A rule with a higher precedence value will be chosen over one with a smaller value. In the case of a tie, the PolicyId is used (larger wins).

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRouteSource.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRouteSource
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRouteSource.description: Is represented as bitset to indicate route sources. It can contain one or more route sources. If the route source is in this bit map, then a route from that source that meets the other criteria of this policy will match the policy.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAdvertiseNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAdvertiseNetListId
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAdvertiseNetListId.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the AdvertiseNetList that are configured for this policy. This has meaning only if the Action is set to 'announce'. It is useful to send or advertise networks that differ from actual network in the routing table. Also allows advertisement of an aggregate or default along with the actual network. Aggregation is useful if a number of routes in the table falls in a certain range. Can save space by sending aggregate route instead of the individual routes. Actual network/route is included in the update only if there is a match or there there is an entry (address & mask pair) 255.255.255.255/255.255.255.255 in the list.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAction.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAction
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceAction.description: It indicates whether the route should be announced or not.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceOspfRouteType.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceOspfRouteType
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceOspfRouteType.description: Ospf Route type. It applies to OSPF sourced routes only. 'type1' means to apply this policy to only type1 OSPF external routes. 'type2' means to apply this policy to only type2 OSPF external routes. 'internal' means 'match ospf specfic routes'. 'any' means apply this policy to all OSPF external routes.

rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipMetric.name: rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipMetric
rcIpPolicyRipAnnounceRipMetric.description: RIP metric. The value is meaningful only if the action is set to 'announce'. This is optional export metric to use when advertising a route that matches this policy. If set to zero, the routing table metric calculated for RIP is is used.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceTableSize
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceTable.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceTable.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceTable
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceTable.description: A table used to store set of announce policies configured for OSPF routing protocol. The Number of entries is given by rcIpPolicyNumOspfPolicies.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceEntry.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceEntry
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceEntry.description: Entry containing configuration information for a particular announce policy.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceId
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceId.description: A value that uniquely identifies the policy associated with this entry.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceName.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceName
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this policy.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceEnable.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceEnable
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceEnable.description: It indicates whether this policy is enabled or not. The policy should be applied only if it is set to 'true'.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExactNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExactNetListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExactNetListId.description: Used to indicate the number of 'exact' type entries that are configured for this policy. An entry with type 'exactNet' or 'rangeNet' represents the network list. This indicates which networks will match a particular announce policy. An entry with a 'exact' type means to only match the specific network advertisement (netaddr & mask). An 'exact' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match the default route'. If set to '0', this policy applies to all the routes.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRangeNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRangeNetListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRangeNetListId.description: Used to indicate zero or more 'range' network entries that are associated with this policy. An entry with a 'range' type means to match any network number that falls in the range indicated by the addr & mask. A 'range' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match any route'. If set to '0', this policy applies to all the routes.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRipGatewayListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRipGatewayListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRipGatewayListId.description: Used to identify the RIP-gatewayList in the list that are associated with this policy. This field has meaning only for RIP sourced routes and if RIP is included as a RouteSource. The list contains one or more rip-routers (other side of the interface) addresses that could send RIP updates to this router. If a router address is included in this list, this policy applies to RIP advertisements from that router. If set to '0', this policy applies to RIP updates received from any rip routers/interfaces.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRipInterfaceListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRipInterfaceListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRipInterfaceListId.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the ripInterfaceIdList that are configured for this policy. This field has meaning only for RIP sourced routes and if RIP is included as a RouteSource. The list contains one or more rip-interface addresses on this router. If an interface address is incuded in this list, this policy applies to RIP advertisements received on that interface. A value of '0' indicates thtat this policy applies to RIP updates received on any rip-interface.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnouncePrecedence.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnouncePrecedence
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnouncePrecedence.description: Is used while comparing this policy rule with other policy that a given route may match. A rule with a higher precedence value will be chosen over one with a smaller value. In the case of a tie, the PolicyId is used (larger wins).

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRouteSource.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRouteSource
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceRouteSource.description: Is represented as bit map to indicate route sources. It can contain one or more route sources. If the route source is in this bit map, then a route from that source that meets the other criteria of this policy will match the policy.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceAdvertiseNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceAdvertiseNetListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceAdvertiseNetListId.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the AdvertiseNetList that are configured for this policy. This has meaning only if the Action is set to 'announce'. It is useful to send or advertise networks that differ from actual network in the routing table. Also allows advertisement of an aggregate or default along with the actual network. Aggregation is useful if a number of routes in the table falls in a certain range. Can save space by sending aggregate route instead of the individual routes. Actual network/route is included in the update only if there is a match or there there is an entry (address & mask pair) 255.255.255.255/255.255.255.255 in the list.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceAction.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceAction
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceAction.description: It indicates whether the route should be announced or not.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExtMetricType.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExtMetricType
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExtMetricType.description: Ospf External metric type. It is used to indicate what type of the external metric it is. 'type1' means to the cost is 'internal ospf cost + ExtMetric'. 'type2' means the ospf-metric is equal to 'type2'.

rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExtMetric.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExtMetric
rcIpPolicyOspfAnnounceExtMetric.description: OSPF External metric. The value is meaningful only if the action is set to 'announce'. This is optional export metric to use when advertising a route that matches this policy. Value '0' is used to indicate that route's actual cost is used to announce.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptTableSize
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyRipAcceptTable.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptTable.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptTable
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptTable.description: A table used to store set of accept policies configured for RIP routing protocol. The Number of entries is given by rcIpPolicyNumRipPolicies.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptEntry.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptEntry
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptEntry.description: Entry containing configuration information for a particular accept policy.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptId
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptId.description: A value that uniquely identifies the policy associated with this entry.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptName.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptName
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this policy.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptEnable.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptEnable
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptEnable.description: It indicates whether this policy is enabled or not. The policy should be applied only if it is set to 'true'.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptExactNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptExactNetListId
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptExactNetListId.description: Used to indicate the number of 'exact' type entries that are configured for this policy. An entry with type 'exactNet' or 'rangeNet' represents the network list. This indicates which networks will match a particular accept policy. An entry with a 'exact' type means to only match the specific network advertisement (netaddr & mask). An 'exact' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match the default route'.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRangeNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRangeNetListId
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRangeNetListId.description: Used to indicate zero or more 'range' network entries that are associated with this policy. An entry with a 'range' type means to match any network number that falls in the range indicated by the addr & mask. A 'range' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match any route'. A null list means 'match any route'.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRipGatewayListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRipGatewayListId
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRipGatewayListId.description: Used to identify the RIP-gatewayList in the PolicyListTable that iares associated with this policy. The list contains the addresses of one or more routers that could send RIP updates to this router. If a router address is included in this list, this policy applies to RIP advertisements from that router. If set to '0', this policy applies to RIP updates from any router.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRipInterfaceListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRipInterfaceListId
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptRipInterfaceListId.description: Used to indicate ListId defined for RipInterfaceList in the rcIpPolicyListTable that is assiciated with this policy. The list contains the addresses of one or more interfaces on this router. If an interface address is included in the list, this policy applies to RIP advertisements received on that interface. If set to '0', this policy applies to RIP updates received on any interface.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptPrecedence.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptPrecedence
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptPrecedence.description: Is used while comparing this policy rule with other policy that a given route may match. A rule with a higher precedence value will be chosen over one with a smaller value. In the case of a tie, the PolicyId is used (larger wins).

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptAction.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptAction
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptAction.description: It indicates whether the route should be acceptd or not.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptInjectNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptInjectNetListId
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptInjectNetListId.description: Used to indicate the ListId of the InjectNetList in the rcIpPolicyListTable entry that is assiciated with for this policy. If teh action is 'accept' and if it is desired to insert networks into the routing table that differ from the actual advertised network. For instance, if a number of networks in a certain range are learned and an aggregate advertisement could be inserted instead of the individual networks. Upon receiving a route that matches this policy, all networks in this list will be considered for inclusion in the routing table. If the list is empty or if the value of the ListId is '0' then the actual received network is considered. An encoding of 255.255.255.255/255.255.255.255 means 'match the actual received network.'. This allows insertion of an aggregate or default along with the actual netowrk.

rcIpPolicyRipAcceptApplyMask.name: rcIpPolicyRipAcceptApplyMask
rcIpPolicyRipAcceptApplyMask.description: If the 'action' is set to 'accept' and the actual received network will be considered, this is an optional IP address mask that will be applied to the network number from the RIP update. This is used to override the interface's subnet mask in the presence of networks with variable length subnet masks.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptTableSize
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptTable.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptTable.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptTable
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptTable.description: A table used to store set of accept policies configured for RIP routing protocol. The Number of entries is given by rcIpPolicyNumRipPolicies.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptEntry.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptEntry
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptEntry.description: Entry containing configuration information for a particular accept policy.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptId
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptId.description: A value that uniquely identifies the policy associated with this entry.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptName.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptName
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this policy.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptEnable.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptEnable
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptEnable.description: It indicates whether this policy is enabled or not. The policy should be applied only if it is set to 'true'.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptExactNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptExactNetListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptExactNetListId.description: Used to indicate the number of 'exact' type entries that are configured for this policy. An entry with type 'exactNet' or 'rangeNet' represents the network list. This indicates which networks will match a particular accept policy. An entry with a 'exact' type means to only match the specific network advertisement (netaddr & mask). An 'exact' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match the default route'.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptRangeNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptRangeNetListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptRangeNetListId.description: Used to indicate zero or more 'range' network entries that are associated with this policy. An entry with a 'range' type means to match any network number that falls in the range indicated by the addr & mask. A 'range' entry with addr=0.0.0.0 and mask=0.0.0.0 means 'match any route'. A null list means 'match any route'.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptPrecedence.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptPrecedence
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptPrecedence.description: Is used while comparing this policy rule with other policy that a given route may match. A rule with a higher precedence value will be chosen over one with a smaller value. In the case of a tie, the PolicyId is used (larger wins).

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptAction.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptAction
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptAction.description: It indicates whether the route should be acceptd or not.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptInjectNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptInjectNetListId
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptInjectNetListId.description: Used to indicate the ListId of the InjectNetList in the rcIpPolicyListTable entry that is assiciated with for this policy. If teh action is 'accept' and if it is desired to insert networks into the routing table that differ from the actual advertised network. For instance, if a number of networks in a certain range are learned and an aggregate advertisement could be inserted instead of the individual networks. Upon receiving a route that matches this policy, all networks in this list will be considered for inclusion in the routing table. If the list is empty or if the value of the ListId is '0' then the actual received network is considered. An encoding of 255.255.255.255/255.255.255.255 means 'match the actual received network.'. This allows insertion of an aggregate or default along with the actual netowrk.

rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptExtType.name: rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptExtType
rcIpPolicyOspfAcceptExtType.description: Used to indicate the ospf external type. This parameter describes which types of OSPF ASE routes match this policy. 'any' means 'match either ASE type 1 or 2'. 'type1' means 'match any external type 1'. 'type2' means 'match any external type 2

rcIpPolicyNetListTableSize.name: rcIpPolicyNetListTableSize
rcIpPolicyNetListTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpPolicyNetListTable.

rcIpPolicyNetListTable.name: rcIpPolicyNetListTable
rcIpPolicyNetListTable.description: A table used to group rcIpPolicyAddrEntry(s) into a list.

rcIpPolicyNetListId.name: rcIpPolicyNetListId
rcIpPolicyNetListId.description: A value that uniquely identifies this list of rcIpPolicyNetListEntry.

rcIpPolicyNetListName.name: rcIpPolicyNetListName
rcIpPolicyNetListName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this list.

rcIpPolicyNetListIdListSize.name: rcIpPolicyNetListIdListSize
rcIpPolicyNetListIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of rcIpPolicyNetEntry id(s) in the rcIpPolicyNetListIdList variable.

rcIpPolicyNetListIdList.name: rcIpPolicyNetListIdList
rcIpPolicyNetListIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more NetListId that are associated to this list. Each NetList identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpPolicyNetListPolicyIdListSize.name: rcIpPolicyNetListPolicyIdListSize
rcIpPolicyNetListPolicyIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of policy id(s) in the Policy Id list. That are referring to this list.

rcIpPolicyNetListPolicyIdList.name: rcIpPolicyNetListPolicyIdList
rcIpPolicyNetListPolicyIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more policies that are referring to this entry. Each policy identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpDvmrpEnable.name: rcIpDvmrpEnable
rcIpDvmrpEnable.description: The enabled status of IP Multicast Dvmrp routing on this router.

rcIpConfDvmrpTable.name: rcIpConfDvmrpTable
rcIpConfDvmrpTable.description: Dvmrp Interface extension table. This table augments the standard dvmrpInterfaceTable defined in <draft-thaler-dvmrp-mib-09.txt>.

rcIpConfDvmrpTableEntry.name: rcIpConfDvmrpTableEntry
rcIpConfDvmrpTableEntry.description: Entry containing Proprietary DVMRP interface information. An entry is automatically created in this table when an ip address is configured on an interface.

rcIpConfDvmrpTableIfIndex.name: rcIpConfDvmrpTableIfIndex
rcIpConfDvmrpTableIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

rcIpConfDvmrpTableEnable.name: rcIpConfDvmrpTableEnable
rcIpConfDvmrpTableEnable.description: The administrative status of DVMRP in the router. The value 'enabled' denotes that the DVMRP is enableed on the interface; 'disabled' disables it on the interface.

rcIpUdpProtocolTableSize.name: rcIpUdpProtocolTableSize
rcIpUdpProtocolTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpUdpProtocolTable.

rcIpUdpProtocolTable.name: rcIpUdpProtocolTable
rcIpUdpProtocolTable.description: list of UDP protocols. Used to determine whether to forward the UDP broadcast packet or not.

rcIpUdpProtocolEntry.name: rcIpUdpProtocolEntry
rcIpUdpProtocolEntry.description: Used to include a particular UDP port in the table. An entry in this table indicates that the box might do forwarding of UDP broadcast packets if there is a matching entry for this packet in the rcIpUdpPortFwdTable.

rcIpUdpProtocolPortNumber.name: rcIpUdpProtocolPortNumber
rcIpUdpProtocolPortNumber.description: well-known UDP Port number. Pre-assigned port number for this protocol. Port used by the server process as its contact port. It cannot be BOOTP/DHCP port#s 67, 68.

rcIpUdpProtocolName.name: rcIpUdpProtocolName
rcIpUdpProtocolName.description: Used to indicate the name of the protocol that is running on top of UDP protocol. cannot change the name once created. This should be set while creating the entry.

rcIpUdpPortFwdTableSize.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdTableSize
rcIpUdpPortFwdTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpUdpPortFwdTable.

rcIpUdpPortFwdEntry.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdEntry
rcIpUdpPortFwdEntry.description: An entry is configured to specify forwarding policy parameters.

rcIpUdpPortFwdDestPort.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdDestPort
rcIpUdpPortFwdDestPort.description: The well-known port number defined for UDP/TCP depending on the value of IpProtoType field in this entry. This port number has to be defined in the rcIpUdpProtoTable. In order to select this policy the destination port number has to match the DestPort value.

rcIpUdpPortFwdDestAddr.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdDestAddr
rcIpUdpPortFwdDestAddr.description: Destination IP address. The IP addres to which the UDP/TCP broadcast should be forwarded. This IP address can be any IP server address or subnet broadcast address. If the IP address is one of the routable interface's address on the router, the frame will be rebroadcast out as a limited broadcast. If the Ip address is that of a server then the received broadcast packet will be sent as a unicast packet to this address.

rcIpUdpPortFwdId.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdId
rcIpUdpPortFwdId.description: Identifier of this entry. Used internally to identify this entry.

rcIpUdpPortFwdFwdListIdListSize.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdFwdListIdListSize
rcIpUdpPortFwdFwdListIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of id(s) in the rcIpUdpPortFwdListId variable.

rcIpUdpPortFwdFwdListIdList.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdFwdListIdList
rcIpUdpPortFwdFwdListIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more rcIpUdpPortFwdListEntry(s) that are referring to this entry. Each list-id identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpUdpPortFwdNumFwdPackets.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdNumFwdPackets
rcIpUdpPortFwdNumFwdPackets.description: The total number of UDP/TCP broadcast packets forwarded using this policy.

rcIpUdpPortFwdNumDropPacketsTtlExpired.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdNumDropPacketsTtlExpired
rcIpUdpPortFwdNumDropPacketsTtlExpired.description: The total number of UDP/TCP broadcast packets dropped because the TTL has expired.

rcIpUdpPortFwdNumDropPacketsDestUnreach.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdNumDropPacketsDestUnreach
rcIpUdpPortFwdNumDropPacketsDestUnreach.description: The total number of UDP/TCP broadcast packets dropped because the rcIpUdpPortFwdDestAddr specified in this policy was unreachable.

rcIpUdpPortFwdListTableSize.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdListTableSize
rcIpUdpPortFwdListTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpUdpPortFwdListTable.

rcIpUdpPortFwdListTable.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdListTable
rcIpUdpPortFwdListTable.description: A table used to group rcIpUdpPortFwdEntry(s) into a list.

rcIpUdpPortFwdListId.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdListId
rcIpUdpPortFwdListId.description: A value that uniquely identifies this list of rcIpUdpPortFwdListEntry.

rcIpUdpPortFwdListName.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdListName
rcIpUdpPortFwdListName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this list.

rcIpUdpPortFwdListFwdIdListSize.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdListFwdIdListSize
rcIpUdpPortFwdListFwdIdListSize.description: Used to indicate the number of rcIpUdpPortFwdNetEntry id(s) in the rcIpUdpPortFwdListIdList variable.

rcIpUdpPortFwdListFwdIdList.name: rcIpUdpPortFwdListFwdIdList
rcIpUdpPortFwdListFwdIdList.description: Used to indicate zero or more UdpPortFwd entries that are associated to this list. Each entry identifier is stored as two bytes in this array starting from offset zero. Any unused bytes should be set to zero.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfTableSize.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfTableSize
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfTableSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the rcIpUdpBroadcastIntfTable.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfEntry.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfEntry
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfEntry.description: Used to configure UDP broadcast forward on a particular interface.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfLocalIfAddr.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfLocalIfAddr
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfLocalIfAddr.description: The ip address of the local interface that is partipating in the forwarding UDP broadcast packets.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfUdpPortFwdListId.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfUdpPortFwdListId
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfUdpPortFwdListId.description: Used to indicate the number UDP ports that this interface is configured to forward. A value of '0' indicates that this interface will not forward any UDP broadcast packets. This is a required field to create an entry.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfMaxTtl.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfMaxTtl
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfMaxTtl.description: Used to indicate the maximum number of hops an IP broadcast packet can take from the source device to the destination device.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumRxPkts.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumRxPkts
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumRxPkts.description: The total number of UDP/TCP broadcast packets received by this local interface.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumFwdPkts.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumFwdPkts
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumFwdPkts.description: The total number of UDP/TCP broadcast packets forwarded.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsMaxTt.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsMaxTtlExpired
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsMaxTt.description: The total number of UDP/TCP broadcast packets dropped because the TTL has expired.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsDestU.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsDestUnreach
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsDestU.description: The total number of UDP broadcast packets dropped because the destination was unreachable.

rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsUnkno.name: rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsUnknownPort
rcIpUdpConfBroadcastIntfNumDropPktsUnkno.description: The total number of UDP/TCP broadcast packets dropped because the destination port/protocol specified has no matching forwarding policy.

rcArpExtLifeTime.name: rcArpExtLifeTime
rcArpExtLifeTime.description: The lifetime in minutues of an ARP entry within the system.

rcArpExtTable.name: rcArpExtTable
rcArpExtTable.description: ARP extension table. This table augments the standard ipNetToMediaTable defined in RFC1213.

rcArpExtEntry.name: rcArpExtEntry
rcArpExtEntry.description: Entry containing Proprietary ARP information. An entry is automatically created in this table when an ip address is configured on an interface.

rcArpExtEntIfIndex.name: rcArpExtEntIfIndex
rcArpExtEntIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

rcArpExtEntDoProxy.name: rcArpExtEntDoProxy
rcArpExtEntDoProxy.description: Enable or disable ARP proxy responses on the specified interface.

rcArpExtEntDoResp.name: rcArpExtEntDoResp
rcArpExtEntDoResp.description: Enable or disable the sending of ARP responses on the specified interface.

rcRipExtOperation.name: rcRipExtOperation
rcRipExtOperation.description: Enable or disable the operation of RIP on all Interfaces.

rcRipExtUpdateTime.name: rcRipExtUpdateTime
rcRipExtUpdateTime.description: The time between transmission of RIP updates on all interfaces.

rcRipExtTable.name: rcRipExtTable
rcRipExtTable.description: RIP extension table. This table augments the standard IfConfTable table in RFC1389.

rcRipExtEntry.name: rcRipExtEntry
rcRipExtEntry.description: Entry containing Proprietary RIP information. An entry is automatically created in this table when an ip address is configured on an interface.

rcRipExtEntIfIndex.name: rcRipExtEntIfIndex
rcRipExtEntIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

rcRipExtEntTalk.name: rcRipExtEntTalk
rcRipExtEntTalk.description: Enable or disable RIP transmission on the specified interface.

rcRipExtEntListen.name: rcRipExtEntListen
rcRipExtEntListen.description: Enable or disable RIP reception on the specified interface.

rcRipExtEntPoison.name: rcRipExtEntPoison
rcRipExtEntPoison.description: Enable or disable operation of poison reverse on the specified interface. If poison is disabled, split-horizon operation is enabled.

rcTestExtTable.name: rcTestExtTable
rcTestExtTable.description: Test extension table. This table augments the standard ifTestTable table in RFC1573.

rcTestExtIfIndex.name: rcTestExtIfIndex
rcTestExtIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

rcTestExtPassCount.name: rcTestExtPassCount
rcTestExtPassCount.description: The number of iterations of the test case that completed successfully.

rcTestExtFailCount.name: rcTestExtFailCount
rcTestExtFailCount.description: The number of iterations of the test case that failed.

rcStatTable.name: rcStatTable
rcStatTable.description: A table used to store port statistics.

rcStatPortIndex.name: rcStatPortIndex
rcStatPortIndex.description: An index value that uniquely identifies a port. This value is similar to ifIndex in MIB2.

rcStatFrameTooShorts.name: rcStatFrameTooShorts
rcStatFrameTooShorts.description: The total number of frames that are too short that were encountered on this interface.

rcStatBridgeInUnicastFrames.name: rcStatBridgeInUnicastFrames
rcStatBridgeInUnicastFrames.description: The total number of incoming unicast frames that were bridged.

rcStatBridgeInMulticastFrames.name: rcStatBridgeInMulticastFrames
rcStatBridgeInMulticastFrames.description: The total number of incoming multicast frames that were bridged.

rcStatBridgeInBroadcastFrames.name: rcStatBridgeInBroadcastFrames
rcStatBridgeInBroadcastFrames.description: The total number of incoming broadcast frames that were bridged.

rcStatBridgeInDiscards.name: rcStatBridgeInDiscards
rcStatBridgeInDiscards.description: The total number of frames that were discarded by the bridging entity.

rcStatBridgeOutUnicastFrames.name: rcStatBridgeOutUnicastFrames
rcStatBridgeOutUnicastFrames.description: The total number of outgoing unicast frames that were bridged.

rcStatBridgeOutMulticastFrames.name: rcStatBridgeOutMulticastFrames
rcStatBridgeOutMulticastFrames.description: The total number of outgoing multicast frames that were bridged.

rcStatBridgeOutBroadcastFrames.name: rcStatBridgeOutBroadcastFrames
rcStatBridgeOutBroadcastFrames.description: The total number of outgoing broadcast frames that were bridged.

rcStatRouteInUnicastFrames.name: rcStatRouteInUnicastFrames
rcStatRouteInUnicastFrames.description: The total number of incoming unicast frames that were routed.

rcStatRouteInMulticastFrames.name: rcStatRouteInMulticastFrames
rcStatRouteInMulticastFrames.description: The total number of incoming multicast frames that were routed.

rcStatRouteInDiscards.name: rcStatRouteInDiscards
rcStatRouteInDiscards.description: The total number of frames that were discarded by the routing entity.

rcStatRouteOutUnicastFrames.name: rcStatRouteOutUnicastFrames
rcStatRouteOutUnicastFrames.description: The total number of outgoing unicast frames that were routed.

rcStatRouteOutMulticastFrames.name: rcStatRouteOutMulticastFrames
rcStatRouteOutMulticastFrames.description: The total number of outgoing multicast frames that were routed.

rcStatGigTable.name: rcStatGigTable
rcStatGigTable.description: A table used to store Gigport error statistics.

rcStatGigPortIndex.name: rcStatGigPortIndex
rcStatGigPortIndex.description: An index value that uniquely identifies a port. This value is similar to ifIndex in MIB2.

rcStatGigLinkFailures.name: rcStatGigLinkFailures
rcStatGigLinkFailures.description: The total number of link failures encountered on this interface.

rcStatGigPacketErrors.name: rcStatGigPacketErrors
rcStatGigPacketErrors.description: The total number of packet errors encountered on this interface.

rcStatGigCarrierErrors.name: rcStatGigCarrierErrors
rcStatGigCarrierErrors.description: The total number of carrier errors encountered on this interface.

rcStatGigLinkInactiveErrors.name: rcStatGigLinkInactiveErrors
rcStatGigLinkInactiveErrors.description: The total number of link inactive errors encountered on this interface.

rcStatGigInFlowCtrlPkts.name: rcStatGigInFlowCtrlPkts
rcStatGigInFlowCtrlPkts.description: The total number of flow control packets received by this interface.

rcStatGigOutFlowCtrlPkts.name: rcStatGigOutFlowCtrlPkts
rcStatGigOutFlowCtrlPkts.description: The total number of flow control packets transmitted by this interface.

rcStatOspfBuffersAllocated.name: rcStatOspfBuffersAllocated
rcStatOspfBuffersAllocated.description: Used to indicate the number of buffers allocated for OSPF.

rcStatOspfBuffersFreed.name: rcStatOspfBuffersFreed
rcStatOspfBuffersFreed.description: Used to indicate the number of buffers that are freed by the OSPF.

rcStatOspfBufferAllocFailures.name: rcStatOspfBufferAllocFailures
rcStatOspfBufferAllocFailures.description: Used to indicate the number of times that OSPF has failed to allocate buffers.

rcStatOspfBufferFreeFailures.name: rcStatOspfBufferFreeFailures
rcStatOspfBufferFreeFailures.description: Used to indicate the number of times that OSPF has failed to free buffers.

rcStatOspfTxPackets.name: rcStatOspfTxPackets
rcStatOspfTxPackets.description: Used to indicate the number of packets transmitted by OSPF.

rcStatOspfRxPackets.name: rcStatOspfRxPackets
rcStatOspfRxPackets.description: Used to indicate the number of packets received by OSPF.

rcStatOspfTxDropPackets.name: rcStatOspfTxDropPackets
rcStatOspfTxDropPackets.description: Used to indicate the number of packets dropped before transmitted by OSPF.

rcStatOspfRxDropPackets.name: rcStatOspfRxDropPackets
rcStatOspfRxDropPackets.description: Used to indicate the number of packets dropped before received by OSPF.

rcStatOspfRxBadPackets.name: rcStatOspfRxBadPackets
rcStatOspfRxBadPackets.description: Used to indicate the number of packets received by OSPF that are bad.

rcStatOspfSpfRuns.name: rcStatOspfSpfRuns
rcStatOspfSpfRuns.description: Used to indicate the number of SPF calculatations performed by OSPF.

rcStatOspfLastSpfRun.name: rcStatOspfLastSpfRun
rcStatOspfLastSpfRun.description: Used to indicate the time(SysUpTime) since the last spf calculated by OSPF.

rcStatIgmpInMsgs.name: rcStatIgmpInMsgs
rcStatIgmpInMsgs.description: Used to indicate the number of Igmp packets received by the device.

rcStatIgmpInErrors.name: rcStatIgmpInErrors
rcStatIgmpInErrors.description: Used to indicate the number of Igmp packets received that are with checksum errors.

rcStatIgmpInQueries.name: rcStatIgmpInQueries
rcStatIgmpInQueries.description: Used to indicate the number of Igmp queries received by the device.

rcStatIgmpInReports.name: rcStatIgmpInReports
rcStatIgmpInReports.description: Used to indicate the number of Igmp reports received by the device.

rcStatIgmpInLeaves.name: rcStatIgmpInLeaves
rcStatIgmpInLeaves.description: Used to indicate the number of Igmp Leaves received by the device.

rcStatIgmpInvalid.name: rcStatIgmpInvalid
rcStatIgmpInvalid.description: Used to indicate the number of Igmp packets received by the device that contained invalid type.

rcStatIgmpOutMsgs.name: rcStatIgmpOutMsgs
rcStatIgmpOutMsgs.description: Used to indicate the number of Igmp queries sent by the device.

rcStatOspfLsdbTblSize.name: rcStatOspfLsdbTblSize
rcStatOspfLsdbTblSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the linkstate database table.

rcStatOspfIfTable.name: rcStatOspfIfTable
rcStatOspfIfTable.description: A table used to store OSPF interface statistics.

rcStatOspfIfIndex.name: rcStatOspfIfIndex
rcStatOspfIfIndex.description: An unique value that is used to identify a physical interface.

rcStatOspfIfRxHellos.name: rcStatOspfIfRxHellos
rcStatOspfIfRxHellos.description: Used to indicate the number hello packets received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfRxDBDescrs.name: rcStatOspfIfRxDBDescrs
rcStatOspfIfRxDBDescrs.description: Used to indicate the number database descriptor packets received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfRxLSUpdates.name: rcStatOspfIfRxLSUpdates
rcStatOspfIfRxLSUpdates.description: Used to indicate the number Link state update packets received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfRxLSReqs.name: rcStatOspfIfRxLSReqs
rcStatOspfIfRxLSReqs.description: Used to indicate the number Link state request packets received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfRxLSAcks.name: rcStatOspfIfRxLSAcks
rcStatOspfIfRxLSAcks.description: Used to indicate the number Link state acknowlege packets received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfTxHellos.name: rcStatOspfIfTxHellos
rcStatOspfIfTxHellos.description: Used to indicate the number hello packets transmitted by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfTxDBDescrs.name: rcStatOspfIfTxDBDescrs
rcStatOspfIfTxDBDescrs.description: Used to indicate the number database descriptor packets transmitted by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfTxLSUpdates.name: rcStatOspfIfTxLSUpdates
rcStatOspfIfTxLSUpdates.description: Used to indicate the number Link state update packets transmitted by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfTxLSReqs.name: rcStatOspfIfTxLSReqs
rcStatOspfIfTxLSReqs.description: Used to indicate the number Link state request packets transmitted by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfTxLSAcks.name: rcStatOspfIfTxLSAcks
rcStatOspfIfTxLSAcks.description: Used to indicate the number Link state acknowlege packets transmitted by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfVersionMismatches.name: rcStatOspfIfVersionMismatches
rcStatOspfIfVersionMismatches.description: Used to indicate the number version mismatches received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfAreaMismatches.name: rcStatOspfIfAreaMismatches
rcStatOspfIfAreaMismatches.description: Used to indicate the number area mismatches received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfAuthTypeMismatches.name: rcStatOspfIfAuthTypeMismatches
rcStatOspfIfAuthTypeMismatches.description: Used to indicate the number AuthType mismatches received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfAuthFailures.name: rcStatOspfIfAuthFailures
rcStatOspfIfAuthFailures.description: Used to indicate the number Authentication failures.

rcStatOspfIfNetMaskMismatches.name: rcStatOspfIfNetMaskMismatches
rcStatOspfIfNetMaskMismatches.description: Used to indicate the number net mask mismatches received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfHelloIntervalMismatches.name: rcStatOspfIfHelloIntervalMismatches
rcStatOspfIfHelloIntervalMismatches.description: Used to indicate the number hello interval mismatches received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfDeadIntervalMismatches.name: rcStatOspfIfDeadIntervalMismatches
rcStatOspfIfDeadIntervalMismatches.description: Used to indicate the number dead interval mismatches received by this interface.

rcStatOspfIfOptionMismatches.name: rcStatOspfIfOptionMismatches
rcStatOspfIfOptionMismatches.description: Used to indicate the number options mismatches received by this interface.

rcStatMltIfExtnTable.name: rcStatMltIfExtnTable
rcStatMltIfExtnTable.description: A table used to store Mlt interface statistics.

rcStatMltEtherTable.name: rcStatMltEtherTable
rcStatMltEtherTable.description: A table used to store Mlt Ethernet statistics.

rcStatMltIpTable.name: rcStatMltIpTable
rcStatMltIpTable.description: A table used to store Mlt Ip statistics.

rcStgMaxStgs.name: rcStgMaxStgs
rcStgMaxStgs.description: The maximum number of spanning tree groups this device can support concurrently.

rcStgNumStgs.name: rcStgNumStgs
rcStgNumStgs.description: The number of spanning tree groups that are currently defined.

rcStgUnassignedPorts.name: rcStgUnassignedPorts
rcStgUnassignedPorts.description: A bitfield used to identify which ports in the system currently not assigned to any STG. The bitfield is 32 octets long representing ports 0 to 255 (inclusive).

rcStgTable.name: rcStgTable
rcStgTable.description: A table used to store Spanning Tree Group (STG) information. Each row in the table specifies a different STG in the device.

rcStgId.name: rcStgId
rcStgId.description: An identifier used to identify a STG in the device.

rcStgTaggedBpduAddress.name: rcStgTaggedBpduAddress
rcStgTaggedBpduAddress.description: The MAC address to be assigned to the destination mac address field in tagged BPDUs. The default address is the well known multicast group address 01-80-c2-00-00-00.

rcStgTaggedBpduVlanId.name: rcStgTaggedBpduVlanId
rcStgTaggedBpduVlanId.description: The VLAN ID to be used for tagging BPDUs.

rcStgBridgeAddress.name: rcStgBridgeAddress
rcStgBridgeAddress.description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must be referred to in a unique fashion. It is recommended that this be the numerically smallest MAC address of all ports that belong to this bridge. However it is only required to be unique. When concatenated with rcStgPriority a unique BridgeIdentifier is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.

rcStgNumPorts.name: rcStgNumPorts
rcStgNumPorts.description: The number of ports controlled by this bridging entity.

rcStgProtocolSpecification.name: rcStgProtocolSpecification
rcStgProtocolSpecification.description: An indication of what version of the Spanning Tree Protocol is being run. The value 'decLb100(2)' indicates the DEC LANbridge 100 Spanning Tree protocol. IEEE 802.1d implementations will return 'ieee8021d(3)'. If future versions of the IEEE Spanning Tree Protocol are released that are incompatible with the current version a new value will be defined.

rcStgPriority.name: rcStgPriority
rcStgPriority.description: The value of the write-able portion of the Bridge ID, i.e., the first two octets of the (8 octet long) Bridge ID. The other (last) 6 octets of the Bridge ID are given by the value of rcStgBridgeAddress.

rcStgTimeSinceTopologyChange.name: rcStgTimeSinceTopologyChange
rcStgTimeSinceTopologyChange.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the last time a topology change was detected by the bridge entity.

rcStgTopChanges.name: rcStgTopChanges
rcStgTopChanges.description: The total number of topology changes detected by this bridge since the management entity was last reset or initialized.

rcStgDesignatedRoot.name: rcStgDesignatedRoot
rcStgDesignatedRoot.description: The bridge identifier of the root of the spanning tree as determined by the Spanning Tree Protocol as executed by this node. This value is used as the Root Identifier parameter in all Configuration Bridge PDUs originated by this node.

rcStgRootCost.name: rcStgRootCost
rcStgRootCost.description: The cost of the path to the root as seen from this bridge.

rcStgRootPort.name: rcStgRootPort
rcStgRootPort.description: The port number of the port which offers the lowest cost path from this bridge to the root bridge.

rcStgMaxAge.name: rcStgMaxAge
rcStgMaxAge.description: The maximum age of Spanning Tree Protocol information learned from the network on any port before it is discarded, in units of hundredths of a second. This is the actual value that this bridge is currently using.

rcStgHelloTime.name: rcStgHelloTime
rcStgHelloTime.description: The amount of time between the transmission of Configuration bridge PDUs by this node on any port when it is the root of the spanning tree or trying to become so, in units of hundredths of a second. This is the actual value that this bridge is currently using.

rcStgHoldTime.name: rcStgHoldTime
rcStgHoldTime.description: This time value determines the interval length during which no more than two Configuration bridge PDUs shall be transmitted by this node, in units of hundredths of a second.

rcStgForwardDelay.name: rcStgForwardDelay
rcStgForwardDelay.description: This time value, measured in units of hundredths of a second, controls how fast a port changes its spanning state when moving towards the Forwarding state. The value determines how long the port stays in each of the Listening and Learning states, which precede the Forwarding state. This value is also used, when a topology change has been detected and is underway, to age all dynamic entries in the Forwarding Database. [Note that this value is the one that this bridge is currently using, in contrast to rcStgBridgeForwardDelay which is the value that this bridge and all others would start using if/when this bridge were to become the root.]

rcStgBridgeMaxAge.name: rcStgBridgeMaxAge
rcStgBridgeMaxAge.description: The value that all bridges use for MaxAge when this bridge is acting as the root. Note that 802.1D-1990 specifies that the range for this parameter is related to the value of rcStgBridgeHelloTime. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second. An agent may return a badValue error if a set is attempted to a value which is not a whole number of seconds.

rcStgBridgeHelloTime.name: rcStgBridgeHelloTime
rcStgBridgeHelloTime.description: The value that all bridges use for HelloTime when this bridge is acting as the root. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D- 1990 to be 1 second. An agent may return a badValue error if a set is attempted to a value which is not a whole number of seconds.

rcStgBridgeForwardDelay.name: rcStgBridgeForwardDelay
rcStgBridgeForwardDelay.description: The value that all bridges use for ForwardDelay when this bridge is acting as the root. Note that 802.1D-1990 specifies that the range for this parameter is related to the value of rcStgBridgeMaxAge. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second. An agent may return a badValue error if a set is attempted to a value which is not a whole number of seconds.

rcStgEnableStp.name: rcStgEnableStp
rcStgEnableStp.description: Indicate whether the spanning tree protocol should be active in this STG.

rcStgStpTrapEnable.name: rcStgStpTrapEnable
rcStgStpTrapEnable.description: Indicate whether traps relating to the spanning tree protocol should be sent for this STG.

rcStgPortMembers.name: rcStgPortMembers
rcStgPortMembers.description: A bitfield used to identify which ports in the system are members this STG. The bitfield is 32 octets long representing ports 0 to 255 (inclusive).

rcStgPortTable.name: rcStgPortTable
rcStgPortTable.description: A table used to store Spanning Tree Group (STG) port related information. If a port is associated with more than one STGs, the port will have one entry in this table for each STG it assigned to.

rcStgPort.name: rcStgPort
rcStgPort.description: The port number of the port for which this entry contains Spanning Tree Protocol management information.

rcStgPortStgId.name: rcStgPortStgId
rcStgPortStgId.description: The STG identifier this port is assigned to.

rcStgPortPriority.name: rcStgPortPriority
rcStgPortPriority.description: The value of the priority field which is contained in the first (in network byte order) octet of the (2 octet long) Port ID. The other octet of the Port ID is given by the value of rcStgPort.

rcStgPortState.name: rcStgPortState
rcStgPortState.description: The port's current state as defined by application of the Spanning Tree Protocol. This state controls what action a port takes on reception of a frame. If the bridge has detected a port that is malfunctioning it will place that port into the broken(6) state. For ports which are disabled (see rcStgPortEnable), this object will have a value of disabled(1).

rcStgPortEnableStp.name: rcStgPortEnableStp
rcStgPortEnableStp.description: The enabled/disabled status of the port.

rcStgPortFastStart.name: rcStgPortFastStart
rcStgPortFastStart.description: When this flag is set, the port is moved straight to the forwarding(5) state upon being enabled.

rcStgPortPathCost.name: rcStgPortPathCost
rcStgPortPathCost.description: The contribution of this port to the path cost of paths towards the spanning tree root which include this port. 802.1D-1990 recommends that the default value of this parameter be in inverse proportion to the speed of the attached LAN.

rcStgPortDesignatedRoot.name: rcStgPortDesignatedRoot
rcStgPortDesignatedRoot.description: The unique Bridge Identifier of the Bridge recorded as the Root in the Configuration BPDUs transmitted by the Designated Bridge for the segment to which the port is attached.

rcStgPortDesignatedCost.name: rcStgPortDesignatedCost
rcStgPortDesignatedCost.description: The path cost of the Designated Port of the segment connected to this port. This value is compared to the Root Path Cost field in received bridge PDUs.

rcStgPortDesignatedBridge.name: rcStgPortDesignatedBridge
rcStgPortDesignatedBridge.description: The Bridge Identifier of the bridge which this port considers to be the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

rcStgPortDesignatedPort.name: rcStgPortDesignatedPort
rcStgPortDesignatedPort.description: The Port Identifier of the port on the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

rcStgPortForwardTransitions.name: rcStgPortForwardTransitions
rcStgPortForwardTransitions.description: The number of times this port has transitioned from the Learning state to the Forwarding state.

rcStgPortInConfigBpdus.name: rcStgPortInConfigBpdus
rcStgPortInConfigBpdus.description: The number of Config BPUDs received by this port.

rcStgPortInTcnBpdus.name: rcStgPortInTcnBpdus
rcStgPortInTcnBpdus.description: The number of Topology Change Notification BPUDs received by this port.

rcStgPortInBadBpdus.name: rcStgPortInBadBpdus
rcStgPortInBadBpdus.description: The number of Bad BPUDs received by this port.

rcStgPortOutConfigBpdus.name: rcStgPortOutConfigBpdus
rcStgPortOutConfigBpdus.description: The number of Config BPUDs transmitted by this port.

rcStgPortOutTcnBpdus.name: rcStgPortOutTcnBpdus
rcStgPortOutTcnBpdus.description: The number of Topology Change Notification BPUDs transmitted by this port.

rcStgNotAllowedPorts.name: rcStgNotAllowedPorts
rcStgNotAllowedPorts.description: A bitfield used to identify which ports in the system that cannot be assigned to any STG (i.e., which ports are single routable ports). The bitfield is 32 octets long representing ports 0 to 255 (inclusive).

rcBridgeFdbTable.name: rcBridgeFdbTable
rcBridgeFdbTable.description: This table is an replacement to the standard dot1dTpFdbTable in rfc1493.

rcBridgeFdbEntry.name: rcBridgeFdbEntry
rcBridgeFdbEntry.description: Information about a specific unicast MAC address for which the bridge has some forwarding information.

rcBridgeFdbStatus.name: rcBridgeFdbStatus
rcBridgeFdbStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

rcBridgeFdbAddress.name: rcBridgeFdbAddress
rcBridgeFdbAddress.description: A unicast MAC address for which the bridge has forwarding and/or filtering information.

rcBridgeFdbPort.name: rcBridgeFdbPort
rcBridgeFdbPort.description: Either the value '0', or the port number of the port on which a frame having a source address equal to the value of the corresponding instance of rcBridgeFdbAddress has been seen. A value of '0' indicates that the port number has not been learned but that the bridge does have some forwarding/filtering information about this address (e.g. in the dot1dStaticTable). Implementors are encouraged to assign the port value to this object whenever it is learned even for addresses for which the corresponding value of rcBridgeFdbStatus is not learned(3).

rcBridgeFdbMonitor.name: rcBridgeFdbMonitor
rcBridgeFdbMonitor.description: Used to indicate whether monitoring should be performed on this unicast MAC address. If monitoring is enabled, any packet received with a matching destination MAC address will be forwarded to the port configured to receive monitor traffic.

rcBridgeFdbPriority.name: rcBridgeFdbPriority
rcBridgeFdbPriority.description: Used to indicate the priority of the incoming frames with this destination Mac Address.

rcBridgeFdbTblSize.name: rcBridgeFdbTblSize
rcBridgeFdbTblSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the bridge forwarding database table.

rcBridgeStaticTable.name: rcBridgeStaticTable
rcBridgeStaticTable.description: This table is a proprietary replacement to the standard dot1dStaticTable in rfc1493.

rcBridgeStaticEntry.name: rcBridgeStaticEntry
rcBridgeStaticEntry.description: A table containing forwarding information about unicast entries configured into the bridge by management. This information is used by the transparent bridging function in determining how to propagate a received frame.

rcBridgeStaticAddress.name: rcBridgeStaticAddress
rcBridgeStaticAddress.description: The MAC address of this entry.

rcBridgeStaticPort.name: rcBridgeStaticPort
rcBridgeStaticPort.description: Port on which the MAC address is found.

rcBridgeStaticMonitor.name: rcBridgeStaticMonitor
rcBridgeStaticMonitor.description: Used to indicate whether monitoring should be performed on incoming packets that match this entry.

rcBridgeStaticPriority.name: rcBridgeStaticPriority
rcBridgeStaticPriority.description: Used to indicate forwarding priority of incoming packets that match this entry.

rcBridgeStaticStatus.name: rcBridgeStaticStatus
rcBridgeStaticStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry. The default value is permanent(3).

rcBridgeStaticTblSize.name: rcBridgeStaticTblSize
rcBridgeStaticTblSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the bridge static table.

rcBridgeFilterTable.name: rcBridgeFilterTable
rcBridgeFilterTable.description: This table is a proprietary replacement to the standard dot1dStaticTable (Filtering information) in rfc1493.

rcBridgeFilterEntry.name: rcBridgeFilterEntry
rcBridgeFilterEntry.description: A table containing filtering information configured into the bridge by management specifying a destination address on a specific port and a set of incoming ports. Frames received from one of the incoming ports and containing the specific destination addresses are not allowed to be forwarded.

rcBridgeFilterAddress.name: rcBridgeFilterAddress
rcBridgeFilterAddress.description: The MAC address of this entry. This address is used to match the destination address of incoming packets.

rcBridgeFilterPort.name: rcBridgeFilterPort
rcBridgeFilterPort.description: Port on which this MAC address is found.

rcBridgeFilterNotAllowedFrom.name: rcBridgeFilterNotAllowedFrom
rcBridgeFilterNotAllowedFrom.description: Used to indicate a set of ports. Traffic arriving on any of the specified ports is not forwarded to this MAC address.

rcBridgeFilterStatus.name: rcBridgeFilterStatus
rcBridgeFilterStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry. The default value is permanent(3).

rcBridgeFilterTblSize.name: rcBridgeFilterTblSize
rcBridgeFilterTblSize.description: Used to indicate the number of entries in the bridge filter table.

rcBootFlashSwVersion.name: rcBootFlashSwVersion
rcBootFlashSwVersion.description: BootFlashSwVersion indicates the software version in the Flash.

rcBootPcmciaSwVersion.name: rcBootPcmciaSwVersion
rcBootPcmciaSwVersion.description: BootPcmciaSwVersion indicate the software version in the Pcmcia card.

rcBootLastBootSource.name: rcBootLastBootSource
rcBootLastBootSource.description: Indicates the boot source of the last the system boot.

rcBootPrimary.name: rcBootPrimary
rcBootPrimary.description: BootPrimary is indicator for the primary source to boot the system.

rcBootSecondary.name: rcBootSecondary
rcBootSecondary.description: BootSecondary indicates the second choice of the boot source.

rcBootTertiary.name: rcBootTertiary
rcBootTertiary.description: BootTertiary indicates the third choice of boot source.

rcDeviceLastBootSource.name: rcDeviceLastBootSource
rcDeviceLastBootSource.description: Used to indicate the source of the software image the system was last booted with.

rcDevicePrimarySource.name: rcDevicePrimarySource
rcDevicePrimarySource.description: Used to indicate the primary choice to get a system software image.

rcDevicePrimarySourceFileName.name: rcDevicePrimarySourceFileName
rcDevicePrimarySourceFileName.description: Used to indicate a file number, if applicable.

rcDeviceSecondarySource.name: rcDeviceSecondarySource
rcDeviceSecondarySource.description: Used to indicate the secondary choice to get a system software image.

rcDeviceSecondarySourceFileName.name: rcDeviceSecondarySourceFileName
rcDeviceSecondarySourceFileName.description: Used to indicate a file name, if applicable.

rcDeviceTertiarySource.name: rcDeviceTertiarySource
rcDeviceTertiarySource.description: Used to indicate the tertiary choice to get a system software image.

rcDeviceTertiarySourceFileName.name: rcDeviceTertiarySourceFileName
rcDeviceTertiarySourceFileName.description: Used to indicate a file name, if applicable.

rcDeviceConfigSource.name: rcDeviceConfigSource
rcDeviceConfigSource.description: Used to indicate the location to get a system configuration file during system boot.

rcDeviceConfigSourceFileName.name: rcDeviceConfigSourceFileName
rcDeviceConfigSourceFileName.description: Used to indicate a file name, if applicable.

rcDeviceFlashBytesUsed.name: rcDeviceFlashBytesUsed
rcDeviceFlashBytesUsed.description: Used to indicate the number of bytes used in the system's configuration flash device.

rcDeviceFlashBytesFree.name: rcDeviceFlashBytesFree
rcDeviceFlashBytesFree.description: Used to indicate the number of bytes available in the system's configuration flash device.

rcDevicePcmciaBytesUsed.name: rcDevicePcmciaBytesUsed
rcDevicePcmciaBytesUsed.description: Used to indicate the number of bytes used in the system's PCMCIA device.

rcDevicePcmciaBytesFree.name: rcDevicePcmciaBytesFree
rcDevicePcmciaBytesFree.description: Used to indicate the number of bytes available in the system's PCMCIA device.

rcDeviceAction.name: rcDeviceAction
rcDeviceAction.description: Used to specify a particular action to perform on one of the system's device.

rcDeviceResult.name: rcDeviceResult
rcDeviceResult.description: Used to indicate the result of the last action performed on one of the system's device.

rcDeviceFlashNumFiles.name: rcDeviceFlashNumFiles
rcDeviceFlashNumFiles.description: Used to indicate the number of files available in the system's configuration flash device.

rcDevicePcmciaNumFiles.name: rcDevicePcmciaNumFiles
rcDevicePcmciaNumFiles.description: Used to indicate the number of files available in the system's PCMCIA device.

rcDeviceFlashEntry.name: rcDeviceFlashEntry
rcDeviceFlashEntry.description: An entry in the system's flash table.

rcDeviceFlashFileNum.name: rcDeviceFlashFileNum
rcDeviceFlashFileNum.description: Used to indicate a particular file in flash.

rcDeviceFlashFileName.name: rcDeviceFlashFileName
rcDeviceFlashFileName.description: Used to indicate a flash file's name.

rcDeviceFlashFileVersion.name: rcDeviceFlashFileVersion
rcDeviceFlashFileVersion.description: Used to indicate the flash file's version.

rcDeviceFlashFileType.name: rcDeviceFlashFileType
rcDeviceFlashFileType.description: Used to indicate the flash file's type.

rcDeviceFlashFileMode.name: rcDeviceFlashFileMode
rcDeviceFlashFileMode.description: Used to indicate the flash file's mode.

rcDeviceFlashFileSize.name: rcDeviceFlashFileSize
rcDeviceFlashFileSize.description: Used to indicate the flash file's size.

rcDeviceFlashFileCrc.name: rcDeviceFlashFileCrc
rcDeviceFlashFileCrc.description: Used to indicate the flash file's CRC.

rcDeviceFlashFileStatus.name: rcDeviceFlashFileStatus
rcDeviceFlashFileStatus.description: Used to indicate the flash file's status. A file that has been marked for deletion, but who's space has not been reclaimed yet is marked as 'deleted'.

rcDevicePcmciaEntry.name: rcDevicePcmciaEntry
rcDevicePcmciaEntry.description: An entry in the system's PCMCIA table.

rcDevicePcmciaFileNum.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileNum
rcDevicePcmciaFileNum.description: Used to indicate a particular file in PCMCIA.

rcDevicePcmciaFileName.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileName
rcDevicePcmciaFileName.description: Used to indicate the PCMCIA file's name.

rcDevicePcmciaFileVersion.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileVersion
rcDevicePcmciaFileVersion.description: Used to indicate the PCMCIA file's version.

rcDevicePcmciaFileType.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileType
rcDevicePcmciaFileType.description: Used to indicate the PCMCIA file's type.

rcDevicePcmciaFileMode.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileMode
rcDevicePcmciaFileMode.description: Used to indicate a particular file in mode.

rcDevicePcmciaFileSize.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileSize
rcDevicePcmciaFileSize.description: Used to indicate the PCMCIA file's size.

rcDevicePcmciaFileCrc.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileCrc
rcDevicePcmciaFileCrc.description: Used to indicate the PCMCIA file's CRC.

rcDevicePcmciaFileStatus.name: rcDevicePcmciaFileStatus
rcDevicePcmciaFileStatus.description: Used to indicate the PCMCIA file's status. A file that has been marked for deletion, but who's space has not been reclaimed yet is marked as 'deleted'.

rcMltNumMlts.name: rcMltNumMlts
rcMltNumMlts.description: The number of MLTs currently defined in the switch.

rcMltPotentialMembers.name: rcMltPotentialMembers
rcMltPotentialMembers.description: The set of ports that are not members of any MLT.

rcMltTable.name: rcMltTable
rcMltTable.description: A list of Multi-Link Trunk entries. The number of entries is given by rcMltNumMlts.

rcMltEntry.name: rcMltEntry
rcMltEntry.description: Entry containing configuration information for a particular Multi-Link Trunk.

rcMltId.name: rcMltId
rcMltId.description: A value that uniquely identifies the Multi-Link Trunk associated with this entry.

rcMltName.name: rcMltName
rcMltName.description: An administratively-assigned name for this MLT.

rcMltPortMembers.name: rcMltPortMembers
rcMltPortMembers.description: The set of ports that are members of this MLT.

rcMltPortType.name: rcMltPortType
rcMltPortType.description: The type of MLT port: access(1) or trunk(2).

rcMltNumVlanIds.name: rcMltNumVlanIds
rcMltNumVlanIds.description: Used to indicate the number of VLAN IDs that are stored in the rcMltVlanIds variable.

rcMltVlanIds.name: rcMltVlanIds
rcMltVlanIds.description: An array used to identify which VLANs this MLT is associated with. Each VLAN ID is stored as a two octet value. The first octet in the pair holds bits 15-8 of the VLAN ID, while the second octet holds bits 7-0 of the VLAN ID.

rcMltRowStatus.name: rcMltRowStatus
rcMltRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcMltTable.

rcMltDistributionAlgorithm.name: rcMltDistributionAlgorithm
rcMltDistributionAlgorithm.description: none(1), ... It will be fill later

rcMltIfIndex.name: rcMltIfIndex
rcMltIfIndex.description: Used to indicate the 'logical' ifIndex assigned to this MLT.

rcWebEnableServer.name: rcWebEnableServer
rcWebEnableServer.description: Control whether the web server should be enabled. Setting this variable to true will make the server operational. Setting this variable to false will disable server.

rcWebRWAUserName.name: rcWebRWAUserName
rcWebRWAUserName.description: User name for the read-write-all web-server account.

rcWebRWAPassword.name: rcWebRWAPassword
rcWebRWAPassword.description: Password for the read-write-all web-server account.

rcWebRWUserName.name: rcWebRWUserName
rcWebRWUserName.description: User name for the read-write web-server account.

rcWebRWPassword.name: rcWebRWPassword
rcWebRWPassword.description: Password for the read-write web-server account.

rcWebROUserName.name: rcWebROUserName
rcWebROUserName.description: User name for the read-only web-server account.

rcWebROPassword.name: rcWebROPassword
rcWebROPassword.description: Password for the read-only web-server account.

rcWebLastChange.name: rcWebLastChange
rcWebLastChange.description: Last web-browser initiated configuration change since sysUpTime.

rcWebNumHits.name: rcWebNumHits
rcWebNumHits.description: Number of hits to the web-server

rcWebNumAccessChecks.name: rcWebNumAccessChecks
rcWebNumAccessChecks.description: Number of access checks performed by the web-server

rcWebNumAccessBlocks.name: rcWebNumAccessBlocks
rcWebNumAccessBlocks.description: Number of accesses blocked by the web-server

rcWebNumRxErrors.name: rcWebNumRxErrors
rcWebNumRxErrors.description: Number of receive errors encountered by the web-server

rcWebNumTxErrors.name: rcWebNumTxErrors
rcWebNumTxErrors.description: Number of transmit errors encountered by the web-server

rcWebNumSetRequest.name: rcWebNumSetRequest

rcCliMaxTelnetSessions.name: rcCliMaxTelnetSessions
rcCliMaxTelnetSessions.description: Used to indicate the maximum number of telnet sessions the system will support.

rcCliMaxRloginSessions.name: rcCliMaxRloginSessions
rcCliMaxRloginSessions.description: Used to indicate the maximum number of rlogin sessions the system will support.

rcCliTimeout.name: rcCliTimeout
rcCliTimeout.description: Used to indicate the amount of idle time, in seconds to wait before timing out telnet and rlogin sessions.

rcCliNumAccessViolations.name: rcCliNumAccessViolations
rcCliNumAccessViolations.description: Used to indicate the number of CLI access violations detected by the system.

rcErrorLevel.name: rcErrorLevel
rcErrorLevel.description: Error level indicator for the last error reported in the system. The meaning of this value are : 0 = Informative Information 1 = Warning Condition 2 = Error Condition 3 = Manufacturing Information 4 = Fatal Condition

rcErrorCode.name: rcErrorCode
rcErrorCode.description: Error code indicator for the last error reported in the system. This is an encoded value that identifies the software module that generated the error message as well as a specific error condition within that module. This value is transparent to the user. This value is intended to help Accelar support and development staff to isolate system problems.

rcErrorText.name: rcErrorText
rcErrorText.description: Error string of the last error reported in the system.

rcErrorReturnCode.name: rcErrorReturnCode
rcErrorReturnCode.description: This variable is used primarily as an enumeration to list the proprietary return codes that this device can send to a management station in response to a failed SNMP operation.

rcErrorSendTrap.name: rcErrorSendTrap
rcErrorSendTrap.description: Indicates whether to send trap upon receiving an error in the system.

rcCardDown.name: rcCardDown
rcCardDown.description: A rcCardDown trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected that the rcCardOperStatus object for one of its cards is about to transition into the down state.

rcCardUp.name: rcCardUp
rcCardUp.description: A rcCardUp trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected that the rcCardOperStatus object for one of its cards is about to transition into the up state.

rcErrorNotification.name: rcErrorNotification
rcErrorNotification.description: A rcErrorNotification trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected that an error condition has occured.

rcStpNewRoot.name: rcStpNewRoot
rcStpNewRoot.description: A rcStpNewRoot trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected the Spanning Tree Protocol has declared the device to be the new root of the spanning tree.

rcStpTopologyChange.name: rcStpTopologyChange
rcStpTopologyChange.description: A rcStpTopologyChange trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected the Spanning Tree Protocol has gone due a topology change event.

rcChasPowerSupplyDown.name: rcChasPowerSupplyDown
rcChasPowerSupplyDown.description: A rcChasPowerSupplyDown trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected that the rcChasPowerSupplyOperStatus object for one of its power supply unit is about to transition into the down state.

rcChasFanDown.name: rcChasFanDown
rcChasFanDown.description: A rcChasFanDown trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected that the rcChasFanOperStatus object for one of its power supply unit is about to transition into the down state.

rcLinkOscillation.name: rcLinkOscillation
rcLinkOscillation.description: A rcLinkOscillation trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has detected an excessive number of link state transitions on the specified port.

rcSyslogGlobalMaxHosts.name: rcSyslogGlobalMaxHosts
rcSyslogGlobalMaxHosts.description: Maximun number of remote hosts considered 'active' and able to receive messages from the Syslog service on the router.

rcSyslogGlobalOperState.name: rcSyslogGlobalOperState
rcSyslogGlobalOperState.description: The operational state of the syslog service on the router.

rcSyslogHostTbl.name: rcSyslogHostTbl
rcSyslogHostTbl.description: Table of remote host destinations for syslog.

rcSyslogHostEntry.name: rcSyslogHostEntry
rcSyslogHostEntry.description: Entry containing information for a particular entry in rcSyslogHostTable.

rcSyslogHostUdpPort.name: rcSyslogHostUdpPort
rcSyslogHostUdpPort.description: Specifies the UDP port to use to send syslog messages to the host.

rcSyslogHostFacility.name: rcSyslogHostFacility
rcSyslogHostFacility.description: Specifies the UNIX facility used in messages to the syslog host. Default is LOCAL7.

rcSyslogHostModuleId.name: rcSyslogHostModuleId
rcSyslogHostModuleId.description: Specifies for which modules/tasks syslog messages should be sent. Default is all modules/tasks.

rcSyslogHostSeverity.name: rcSyslogHostSeverity
rcSyslogHostSeverity.description: Specifies the severity level for which syslog messages should be sent for the modules specifies in 'SyslogHostModule'.

rcSyslogHostMapInfoSeverity.name: rcSyslogHostMapInfoSeverity
rcSyslogHostMapInfoSeverity.description: Specifies the syslog severity to use for Accelar INFO messages. Default is INFO.

rcSyslogHostMapWarningSeverity.name: rcSyslogHostMapWarningSeverity
rcSyslogHostMapWarningSeverity.description: Specifies the syslog severity to use for Accelar WARNING messages. Default is WARNING. Should be <= INFO.

rcSyslogHostMapErrorSeverity.name: rcSyslogHostMapErrorSeverity
rcSyslogHostMapErrorSeverity.description: Specifies the syslog severity to use for Accelar ERROR messages. Default is ERROR. Should be <= WARNING.

rcSyslogHostMapMfgSeverity.name: rcSyslogHostMapMfgSeverity
rcSyslogHostMapMfgSeverity.description: Specifies the syslog severity to use for Accelar Manufactoring messages. Dafault is ERROR.

rcSyslogHostMapFatalSeverity.name: rcSyslogHostMapFatalSeverity
rcSyslogHostMapFatalSeverity.description: Specifies the syslog severity to use for Accelar FATAL messages. Default is EMERGENCY. Should be <= ERROR.

rcSyslogHostMapTraceMsg.name: rcSyslogHostMapTraceMsg
rcSyslogHostMapTraceMsg.description: Specifies the syslog severity to use for syslog trace messages. Default is DEBUG.

rcSyslogHostMapTrapMsg.name: rcSyslogHostMapTrapMsg
rcSyslogHostMapTrapMsg.description: Specifies the UNIX severity code to use for syslog messages for SNMP traps sent to the syslog host. Default is INFO.

rcSyslogHostLogTraceMsgs.name: rcSyslogHostLogTraceMsgs
rcSyslogHostLogTraceMsgs.description: Indicate whether to activate the host to log the syslog trace messages.

rcSyslogHostLogTrapMsgs.name: rcSyslogHostLogTrapMsgs
rcSyslogHostLogTrapMsgs.description: Indicate whether to activate the host to log the syslog messages for SNMP traps.

rcSyslogHostEnable.name: rcSyslogHostEnable
rcSyslogHostEnable.description: Enable/Disable messages to be sent to syslog host.

rcSyslogHostRowStatus.name: rcSyslogHostRowStatus
rcSyslogHostRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcSyslogTable.

rcDiagMirrorByPortEntry.name: rcDiagMirrorByPortEntry
rcDiagMirrorByPortEntry.description: Entry containing mirror by port infomation.

rcDiagMirrorByPortRowStatus.name: rcDiagMirrorByPortRowStatus
rcDiagMirrorByPortRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcDiagMirrorByPortTable.

rcDiagPortConvSteeringEntry.name: rcDiagPortConvSteeringEntry
rcDiagPortConvSteeringEntry.description: Entry containing infomation of Diag Port Conv Steering.

rcDiagPortConvSteeringRowStatus.name: rcDiagPortConvSteeringRowStatus
rcDiagPortConvSteeringRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcDiagMirrorByPortTable.

rcDiagMacConvSteeringEntry.name: rcDiagMacConvSteeringEntry
rcDiagMacConvSteeringEntry.description: Entry containing infomation of Diag Mac Conv Steering.

rcDiagMacConvSteeringRowStatus.name: rcDiagMacConvSteeringRowStatus
rcDiagMacConvSteeringRowStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcDiagMirrorByPortTable.

rcIpxAddrTable.name: rcIpxAddrTable
rcIpxAddrTable.description: The table of addressing information relevant to this entity's IPX addresses. This table is used for associating IfIndex and IPX network number.

rcIpxAddrEntry.name: rcIpxAddrEntry
rcIpxAddrEntry.description: The addressing information for one of this entity's IP addresses.

rcIpxAddrVlanId.name: rcIpxAddrVlanId
rcIpxAddrVlanId.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

rcIpxAddrEntryStatus.name: rcIpxAddrEntryStatus
rcIpxAddrEntryStatus.description: Used to create/delete entries in the rcIpxAddrEntry.

rcIpxAddrEncap.name: rcIpxAddrEncap
rcIpxAddrEncap.description: Specify IPX encapsulation format. It is relevent if the VLAN is port based. But it's always nice to have it.
